Consumer complaint narrative:
At this moment, I do not recall how I became aware of this debt, but I phoned the collections company on XX/XX/XXXX to request a detailed invoice for the debt. When I last talked with XXXX, no one could tell me what the debt was for. 
In short, the phones I received from XXXX did not work, I returned them. At that time I paid a restock fee and asked to pay any outstanding bill. The rep double checked and said I did not have one.  Later that month I received a bill for {$1700.00}. I called the store, but in the end, no one could tell me what the bill was for and subsequently stopped answering my calls. The next month the bill was {$1500.00}. I eventually got through to an online customer service rep and they realized some of the phones were not returned. After updating my account, there was still a balance for {$240.00}. He could not tell me why. 
When this balance showed up in collections, I phoned the company on XX/XX/2020. I informed them that XXXX could not tell me what the bill was for and before I would pay, I wanted an itemized invoice. Given all the inaccurate info they previously reported, I wanted to be sure this is a valid debt. The rep seemed to agree. On XX/XX/2020 I received an alert on my credit report for this balance. I had not heard back from the collections company. I phoned them to inquire about what happened since our last conversation. XXXX XXXX informed me that she was aware of my previous request and that I previously told them that I did not believe it was a valid debt. She said they did not receive a reply from XXXX and stated that she made another request while I was on the phone. I asked is it appropriate to report a debt you can not verify, she said yes. She stated the call was recorded so this can be confirmed. My primary concern is because I have no accounts in collection on my report and have a business transaction this could kill. She said give her a week and I do not have a week. 
I am asking they honor their first conversation with me. Prove the debt is valid and give me an opportunity to pay. I truly do not understand how and why I am expected to pay a sum of money just because a company said so and how a collection company can report a negative account without proof of the debt. 
Finally, this was a XXXX XXXX acct, I feel it was not set up properly if it is reported on my personal account. I was told my personal info was only needed for the credit check. this is more of a XXXX issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This incident involves three companies : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( " XXXX   '' ), United Services Automobile Association ( " USAA '' ), and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( " XXXX  '' ). 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I was in an accident where a USAA insured driver, Ms. XXXX XXXX, was at fault. USAA claim number is XXXX. USAA paid for my car to be fixed and I was given a car by XXXX to use while my vehicle was in the shop. After returning the rental car when my vehicle was fixed, USAA was billed for the amount of {$470.00} for the 16 days the rental car was in use. USAA decided to only pay {$290.00} for what they estimated should be the price for a rental car. XXXX only billed USAA and I never received nor heard anything again after dropping the rental car off from USAA nor XXXX. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed that a derogatory account showed up on my credit report. The derogatory account was for a collection agency, XXXX. After investigating with XXXX on what this was for, I found out that this was for the XXXX  leasing for the accident that USAA was supposed to cover. XXXX sent me the paper work they had on file. That was the first time I saw the bill to USAA for {$470.00}. A person at XXXX noted on the bill that they only received {$290.00} from USAA. There was renter information on the bill for myself but all of my contact information was wrong, but it was billed to USAA 's address for for USAA to pay. USAA should have taken care of this since it was their insured driver at fault. 

I contacted USAA to inform them that their bill was showing up on my credit report and asked why they didn't pay this bill and how to resolve the issue. They argued that they didn't owe the full amount because it exceeded the estimated 10 days to fix my vehicle. I told them that it was out of my control on how long it took to fix my vehicle and the rental car bill included weekends as well. They realized that they had made a mistake and thought the bill was for 16 business days instead of the actual 11. They agreed to pay XXXX an additional {$140.00}. 

I contacted XXXX to make sure that they received the additional payment. They did receive the {$140.00} from USAA, but an outstanding amount of {$120.00} remained on the bill because of derogatory fees. I contacted USAA again to explain that there was still a balance on the bill. They refused to pay it because they don't pay derogatory fees. I thought this was ridiculous because these are derogatory fees for their bill they ignored. This is a bill to USAA that was never billed to me and is now showing on my credit report. 

I contacted XXXX and asked if they would drop the derogatory fees since my renter information was wrong on the bill, I was never contacted by USAA nor XXXX, and I was not at fault for not receiving a bill that wasn't actually billed to me. They agreed to wave those fees but an amount of {$44.00} remained. By this time, I could not deal anymore with this matter considering the amount of time I had spent trying to fix this. I payed the remaining {$44.00} even though this was billed to USAA and they should be the one 's to pay this amount. I never thought I would be in an accident where I was not at fault and have to fight so much with the other driver 's insurance agency. If USAA is doing this to me, they are doing this to many people. 

If I was billed for a rental car, I would have paid it. USAA was billed for this rental car. They should have paid their bill!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Citibank insistently marketed to me their citigold account : the offer involved opening a checking account, plus investment accounts holding $ XXXX or more to receive a bonus of {$1500.00} after 60 days plus a XXXX enhancement in the cashback bonus I already enjoyed with my Citi Mastercard. 
I held the accounts ( checking and investment ) with over $ XXXX from XX/XX/XXXX, and at XX/XX/XXXX I requested my benefits. 
The chat feature in the website responded they couldn't do that and I had to call a phone number. 
I called the phone number and they had me waiting on hold for 20+ minutes, during which I could not do anything else, because the " music on hold '' consisted of a distracting drone repeating every 10 seconds that I should be doing this online. 
Finally, an attendant responded and as soon as I explained my request, the call was dropped. 
I can't know for certain that this was intentional, but I do know for certain that the bank didn't call me back, and the bank didn't credit the promised rewards during the following few days. 
Not having another 20 minutes to spare, I have not attempted the maneuver again : today I closed the accounts. Still, I had earned the {$1500.00} and citibank failed to honor their marketing promise.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My entire wallet, including all credit and debit cards and my drivers license were stolen out of my office at work on the morning of Tuesday, XX/XX/2020, while I was on the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX As soon as I received cell phone alerts that there was concern for fraudulent activity on my account from US Bank, I immediately returned to my office to find my entire wallet missing. More charges continued to come in. 
I immediately reported the theft to my campus security officer and called US Bank and XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX all personal accounts I had at both banks showed multiple credit and debit accounts with fraudulent activity ) that day and spoke with one of US Bank 's representatives to make the above claim as well as regarding debit card activity. At that time US Bank rep made me aware of the fraudulent charges named in a report made with the XXXX Police  Bureau and FTC ID theft report, made on the morning of XX/XX/2020. The amounts included in the police report were based on the amounts given to me by US Bank representative as they had not yet posted to my account online. I actually worked to transition the bulk of my direct deposits and bill pays from XXXX  XXXX XXXX to US Bank because of how helpful and dedicated US Bank representatives were initially. 
I then complied with everything US Bank investigators asked me to do, including faxing the police and ID theft reports to the US Bank Fraud Department on XX/XX/2020. I only received communication that the claim was under review until the week of XX/XX/2020 when I noticed that {$1800.00} and {$2400.00} XXXX the latter amount of which was not even included in my original call with your representative ) were taken back out of the above account. I called on Friday the XXXX to ask for explanation and was told that my case Processor XXXX would call me back. When I did not receive a called from XXXX, I called the fraud department again on Monday the XXXX and was told that a police report was never received. I refaxed both reports on Tuesday XX/XX/2020 and called to confirm that the fax was received. I spoke with XXXX who confirmed that the fax was received. At that time, I expressed additional concern about the handling of this case. XXXX stated that she would have XXXX manager, XXXX, call me back. 
I received a call from XXXX, not XXXX, on the morning of XX/XX/2020. XXXX stated that he would not change the ruling as both the bank card and ID were used at a teller to make the cash advances. I explained to him that my ID was stolen along with my card and he stated that information did not matter as the transaction was made with a teller. I explained to XXXX that during the time of the theft my county, where this took place, was still under a Stay at Home order from the governor of Oregon as a result of COVID-19 ( see XXXX XXXX   XXXX ). At the time of the theft, nearly all bank transactions were made with drive-through tellers ( most branches were closed ) and masks were required for any business transactions indoors. With drive-through tellers and masks, a mistaken identity would have been understandable. According to XXXX, he would also not take this into consideration, stating that the signature on the advance requests seemed to match mine on the fraud claim. Again, this thief had possession of my drivers license that had my signature on it, making it incredibly easy to forge! 
My cards AND my drivers license ( which featured my signature ) were not in my possession. In fact, as documented in the addendum to the police report, the entire wallet was mailed back to me by a local business who found the wallet and contents soaking wet on their grounds weeks later ( I have kept the wallet, envelope it was mailed in and letter from the establishment. ) Furthermore, there were numerous other fraudulent charges, withdrawals made on XX/XX/2020 with my US Bank accounts and XXXX  XXXX XXXX accounts, which XXXX also stated he would not consider because of the signature in question. 
It was my understanding that none of this was considered on the ruling made by XXXX and supported by XXXX and was told the only option left was to appeal via fax or mail to the Office of the President at US  Bank.

Consumer complaint narrative:
CREDIT ACCEPTANCE IS THE WORST! 
Tennessee law requires that your lender send you a 10-day letter after it has repossessed your car. This letter is official notice that youre entitled to redeem the vehicle by paying off the loan, plus fees and costs associated with the repossession. You then have 10 days to come up with the money, and your lender cant sell the car until after this redemption period has passed. 

Predatory lending is any lending practice that imposes unfair or abusive loan terms on a borrower. It is also any practice that convinces a borrower to accept unfair terms through deceptive, coercive, exploitative or unscrupulous actions for a loan that a borrower doesn't need, doesn't want or can't afford. 

Prepayment penalties plus they made my note seem cheap just to add unnecessary charges and taxes when I tried to pay. 
When I extra and paid on time I was still marked as late. AND LITERALLY NOTHING WENT TO MY ACTUAL BALANCE. 
My car stopped working two days after I got it, I notified them. They wouldnt do anything about it or defer at least one payment. When I finally got it back working. The ALTERNATOR AND STARTER WENT OUT ON A 2014! 
I told them that this goes against LEMON LAWS ( literally the same week I got my car ) I WAS PAYING A NOTE ON A CAR I COULDNT USE FOR TWO MONTHS!! The MOTOR WAS BAD. They gave me the car and supposedly it had a oil change. WHY WAS BLACK TAR COMING OUT. The pieces connect to the oil container were melted on and the piece had to be broken off at XXXX. Over {$600.00} for the replacements. they wouldnt give me the info to do a LEMON LAW claim so I mailed it to them! Which is what the state says to do to claim lemon laws and they are supposed to forward it. 
They failed to notify me of selling the car ( AFTER I TRIED TO GET IT BACK the next day!! because I put a lot of money into it AND THEY WOULDNT GIVE IT BACK ) which is required BY LAW. I literally had the cash amount to pay it off from a school refund. They told me if I paid it off early I would have to pay a lot extra ( prepayment fees ) Their loans are so predatory! My interest kept changing. 
They sold my car while I was trying to get it back and literally didnt notify me that the sold it. Not even a letter in the mail! 
Not to mention, when I called to get deferred because the XXXX WAS NOT WORKING. The lady asked me why did you get a car if you dont have money to fix it then I said maam could we keep it professional and she cursed me out. I hung up and called back. Only had one nice man that I would talk to! This company is THE WORSE COMPANY I EVER EXPERIENCED. 
Now they wont settle with me or delete it off my credit when its not my fault and I tried to reconcile! YOU SOLD ME A XXXX AND WOULD NOT LET ME DO A CLAIM OR GIVE IT BACK. I lost my job messing with that car A GOOD JOB. 
I got the car on XX/XX/XXXX, it stopped on XX/XX/XXXX. Got it fixed and it stopped completely in XXXX In total I have put more than $ 2k in the car

Consumer complaint narrative:
I discovered a collections account when I pulled my credit report. After digging around it was determined this account was a XXXX account. The address they show that opened the account was in XXXX. I have lived in Washington State since XX/XX/1990. 
I have disputed the debt several times. I have never received any bills on this account. The address on file was determined to be fraud and was removed immediately, but the collections still remains on my credit report. 

After doing some additional investigation it appears this company does this quite often to other unsuspecting consumers.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Ive been diligently paying off my balance on my Best Buy card. When covid quarantine hit in XXXX i started paying all my credit cards on the day i received my direct deposit into my bank account to make sure they got paid each month. I also started paying more than the balance due to pay off my balance and alleviate XXXX payment due each month. My friend in XXXX died on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX from the virus and i have XXXX and XXXX so i am at an increased risk to get a severe case or die if i get infected. 
What I didnt realize was that best buy c/o citibank was applying my monthly payments to the previous months cycle starting in XXXX when they attributed my XX/XX/XXXX payment as a second payment to the XXXX billing cycle and then assessing me a late fee for XXXX. Apparently citibank closes each months billing cycle on the XXXX of the following month. The Best Buy app doesnt alert you to which billing cycle your payment will be credited to when making your payments online, nor does it say youre making a XXXX monthly payment. Neither does best buy/citibank send you an email or alert you that a late fee has been assessed to your account. Each month the late fee is increased. 
I caught the late fees and called to speak with best buy citibank. They said they could only remove XXXX late fee and it was my fault for not understanding that the payment due date and the billing cycle closing date are XXXX different dates. 
I spoke with multiple people on XX/XX/XXXX. I asked to get a callback from a senior account XXXX to discuss the situation. I was told i would get a callback the following day. I did not receive XXXX. I called back and again spoke with multiple representatives and recorded the conversations and disclosed that i was recording the call. I told the gentlemen that XXXX payments were credited to XXXX when i intended XXXX to pay applied to XXXX and that i was since then being assessed late fees each month for paying too early on each month. He kept putting me on hold to review my account. He insisted that he only saw XXXX payment per month and the late fees were justified. It was only when i looked up the dates of payments applied to the XXXX billing cycle that he was able to see the XXXX payments. When i asked to speak with a senior account manager he kept placing me on hold, returning to ask me to wait longer, and then he just hung up on me. I still havent been contacted by any senior account rep. 
In XXXX, best buy citibank sent out a lengthy email statement saying they were working hard to assist their customers during the pandemic and i have enclosed screenshots. 
So how are they helping me by applying payments to the previous billing cycle, assessing me late fees totally almost {$150.00} and refusing to understand my intentions at paying early, refusing to adjust my payments, and remove the late fees, and either not having a senior account rep return my call or disconnecting me?!!! 
This is a deplorable and opportunistic way to assess more debt to a customers account during an pandemic where they give lip service to trying to help their customers and offering postponement of monthly payments if requested due to financial hardship. I am disgusted!!!

Consumer complaint narrative:
My loan is currently serviced by SLS. They recently issued a notice of default claiming that {$1600.00} was needed to cure the default. This amount was paid to bring the account current. SLS claims that the account is still in default and proceeding with foreclosure action. SLS has not provided any records to prove up up the overall validity of the debt. 
As defined under Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ) Fair Debt Collection Practices Act as well as the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), it is required that current creditors hold the necessary documentation granting the authority of servicing rights and all applicable mortgage assignments from one lien holder to the next. These documents have been request in writing by way of a Qualified Written Request ( QWR ). SLS is in violation RESPA and CFPB law for proceeding with foreclosure action on a current loan. Since SLS is ignoring my requests for clarification on this matter, I am seeking your assistance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Fingerprint Requirement to cash checks - Possible Security RISKS to personal technology and privacy - MUFG Union Bank  Office of the President and XXXX XXXX XXXX CFPB, MUFG Union Bank, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX : This complaint was filed due to not receiving any response about my check cashing experience at your bank located in California. I am a current safety box ( Signature Card Holder ) at branch that cashed check. Please ask XXXX that she can verify my signature on file and she knows me as I am a former employee. Is this the way you treat ALL former employees of the bank? 

On XX/XX/2019, I went to the local branch of Union Bank or MUFG Union Bank and wanted to cash a check written to me from my mom ( Check Number XXXX in the amount of {$760.00} was drawn on Union Bank ). I went to the teller window and was asked for 2 pieces of Identification. I had that and provided it. Next, they asked me for ID to cash my mom 's check. I was shocked at the request and had the employee ask XXXX ( Customer Service Manager ) if I still had to give the fingerprint even if she can vouch for me as a her former employee. According to her, I was required to provide the fingerprint. It hurt me that they did not trust me cashing my own mother 's check. 

Trust is very important and I did nothing wrong for them to treat me less than equal to other former employees. Also, due to the new smartphone technologies, fingerprints are now more a security or privacy risk and can be a possible violation of 4th amendment rights. The use of fingerprints as unlock feature can pose as this risk and the bank should protect consumers, as well as, find new ways to secure assets. No one believes me. 

I previous complaint was filed with the CFPB and hope this can be resolved correctly. Can you please ask XXXX XXXX why I am unable to bank with my family at Union Bank or MUFG Union Bank and to avoid these type of check cashing issues in the future? 

Respectfully submitted for review.

Consumer reporting agencies must correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information. Inaccurate, incomplete or unverifiable information must be removed or corrected, usually within 30 days.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a promotional letter from Synchrony Mastercard saying I was pre-approved their new credit card, featuring 2 % cash back and {$150.00} account credit if I spend over {$1500.00} within the first 90 days of account opening. I replied online since I deemed it's a good deal. Yet after over a week 's wake, I received a call from Mastercard company asking about why I wanted to apply for the card, they needed some credentials, I told them I was simply replying to the synchrony 's promotional offer, then due to that delay and the planned trip that took place on XX/XX/XXXX -- I checked my mail box every day before the vacation trip to New York for XXXX, so that I can use the card during vacation. It didn't arrive prior to my departure ( XX/XX/XXXX ). When we returned on the XXXX, I then located the approved credit card in the mail box, activate it, and started using it. 

I spent over {$1500.00} during the first 90 days once I activated the card, but received no {$150.00} account credit. I contacted synchrony, multiple times, first they said the 90 days starts when I first responded to them, I then explained that I got an extra call from Mastercard company and I couldn't activate my card, on XX/XX/XXXX, they sent me an email with an attached letter saying that the account credit would appear on my account within 1-2 billing cycle, but since then I still received nothing. I contacted them again by the end of XXXX, they said they did not know how the " reward department '' handled it and I had no way to contact them. Therefore, no reward as they claimed so far.

Consumer complaint narrative:
By letter dated XX/XX/XXXX that is enclosed hereto as Exhibit " A '', XXXX XXXX ( " XXXX '' ) and PHH Mortgage Services ( " PHH '' ) responded to my complaint filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) as complaint number XXXX with false statements as it pertains to an already time-barred debt and mortgage identified with account number XXXX, by : falsely addressing the Estate of XXXX XXXX XXXX as the Customer ( s ) for the above referenced account number when no such estate is connected to my property, and my husbands name was not XXXX XXXX XXXX ; and falsely declaring that I defaulted on my mortgage loan as of XX/XX/XXXX and mentioning the active illegal foreclosure under Docket No. XXXX wherein XXXX and PHH are falsely declaring XX/XX/XXXX as the date of default, when at all relevant times : ( 1 ) the false date of default as of XX/XX/XXXX contradicts the XX/XX/XXXX date declared for the same transaction under Docket No. : XXXX and a true copy of foreclosure complaint filed therein on XX/XX/XXXX ( the same day of my husbands death ) is attached hereto as Exhibit B ; ( 2 ) the false date of default as of XX/XX/XXXX misrepresents and falsely implies that payments were made towards the subject account number from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX ; and ( 3 ) the false date of default as of XX/XX/XXXX unlawfully conceals approximately $ XXXX in payments that I tendered for the months due XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX during an extreme time of grief upon my husbands death, with approximately $ XXXX being cashed by predecessors and affiliates of XXXX and PHH as displayed within the checks enclosed hereto as Exhibit C. 

Furthermore, the foregoing parties along with their co-conspirator XXXX XXXX XXXX ( " XXXX XXXX  '' ) are willfully refusing to answer and provide the information demanded by communications dating back to the end of XXXX to present date, pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1962 ( g ) ) ; N.J.S.A. 12A:3-308 ; the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ) ( 12 U.S.C. 2605 ( e ) ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. ) ; and 15 U.S.C. 7021 ( f ). 

In closing, the conduct set forth above constitutes false statements to the CFPB by XXXX and PHH in response to complaint number XXXX in violation of 18 U.S.C. 1001, mail fraud in violation of 18 U.S.C. 1341 and continued engagement in unfair, deceptive, and unlawful practices by the foregoing parties in violation of consent judgments entered in the U.S. District Court for  the District of Columbia on XX/XX/XXXX in Case No. XXXX and Case No. XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have an account with NewRez LLC d.b.a. Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing. Due to hardship induced by the COVID-19 pandemic, I fell behind on my mortgage payments. I attempted to call numerous times ( at least 12 ) to fix this issue during the months of XXXX and XXXX ( before I went delinquent on the account, but I was never able to get through to a representative, sometimes leaving my phone on speaker phone for over an hour while I waited ), and I called at least 5 times during XXXX and XXXX ( after being late on my payment ). In XXXX, I was able to make contact with Shellpoint ( about 2 and a half weeks ago ), and the representative there explained that I had a caseworker for my account and to call that person the first week of XXXX to discuss an option that was available to me. It was explained that this option would make FHA assume 3 of my mortgage payments and add them to the end of my loan, fee and interest free. A part of my loan program allows me to move at least one payment to the end of my loan as a part of my terms and conditions anyway, and when I spoke to the representative 2 and a half weeks ago, I explained that to her as well before she gave me the first option mentioned above. I also explained this to the representative today who continued to read me a letter I've never seen before that didn't mention any of what I was told, and the place she advised me to go just kept referring me to options that didn't fit my situation. My initial intent was to move one payment to the end of my loan term ( benefit spelled out in my terms and conditions of my contaract ) and make 2 months worth of payments to be completely caught up and current, but because of what I was told, I used the extra money to pay other creditors I owed. This situation needs to be remedied. I feel asking me to make my full forbearance payment right now i unfair and deceptive. They should really have representatives that are on the same page and that provide accurate information, especially during this uncertain and hard time we're facing as a country. I would've paid this when I had my first conversation if it wasn't for the information I was given ( I said that on the phone call as well and I also verbally confirmed this program would be available to me when I spoke to the representative of Shellpoint a couple weeks back ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is in addition to existing claim # : XXXX. I am adding documents to the this dispute / complaint. 

Since XXXX, my family and I had XXXX as our home security. In early XXXX, a technician came to our home claiming to be an XXXX tech and stated they were going to their customers home to schedule appointments, as a courtesy, to upgrade their security equipment to their latest model. He stated the system we had was outdated and they are having trouble with many of their customers with the same systems. We agreed to the update/ upgrade. Before the tech left our home, he stated we had to sign, stating we agree to the upgrade and that our bill would be discounted because I was XXXX XXXX military. 

Approx 2 months later, I called XXXX because I was having constant beeping issues with the system. The XXXX rep advised me that I did not have an active account with them and that the service was disconnected. I explain to the XXXX rep of the upgrade by their technician and what happened. The XXXX rep stated no one from their company came to our home and did any installs and nothing was wrong with our old system. She stated that it seems we were scammed. 

I then tried to contact the tech that came to our home and no answer, so I called the number on the card he left us. I explain to that Customer Service rep of what happened and she stated they are XXXX and not XXXX. I told her that I would like to cancel the service as we did not agree to change company. The tech stated he was from XXXX. 

The customer service rep stated we signed a contract and would have to pay the termination fee if we cancelled. I then asked to speak to manager because this was fraud as we were misled that we were upgrading our existing XXXX monitoring system/ equipment. I also stated that I will pursue legal action against this company, with our XXXX XXXX Legal office because I am sure this was illegal. 

The rep placed me on hold. After several minutes of holding, the rep stated they will agree to cancel the contract and that we would be at a month to month service agreement with them. She asked that we give them another chance to fix the system and keep the service. I agreed to the month to month service and the rep transferred me to troubleshoot the beeping noise. 

Throughout the next year, we continue to have issue with the alarm, as it would always say ( red button ) that our doors and windows were opened. Also, we had problems with the alarm " arming ''. 

In late XXXX, I called XXXX and advised the rep to TOTALLY disconnect the service and that I was switching back to XXXX. After the call we never heard from XXXX since, until we received this collection letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX sent me a letter dated XXXX XX/XX/XXXX in which I mailed a letter back to them disputing this debt on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX notified XXXX  of this debt, which is against the law, as I had disputed this debt within the 30-day notice. XXXX XXXX did not follow the law in reporting this debt correctly as XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX is under the 30-days allowed to dispute. 

On XXXX XXXX, I sent a certified letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX  disputing this debt again, also within the 30-days dispute notice. 

On XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX reported this debt to my XXXX  report, but listed it as PERFECTION Collections, LLC. I have never received a letter/notice from Perfection Collections, LLC. Per my XXXX  Credit Report, the address for Perfection Collections, LLC is the same as XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

There is a whole lot of illegal action/reporting going on with this account and I request that this debt is removed QUICKLY from all reports and NEVER added back again as I do not owe this debt to XXXX nor XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
A payoff for a reverse mortgage with AAG was requested and received for XX/XX/2020. Due to some problems with the financing company the the closing had to be postponed until XX/XX/2020. A request was made on XX/XX/2020 at XXXX XXXX by the title company for a revised payoff. The AAG said it would take five to 10 days to respond to the request. Since the the closing was scheduled for XX/XX/2020 this was not acceptable. Numerous call were made to the AAG Payoff department by the title company and the mortgage holder but they refused to provide a mortgage payoff. Because of the refusal by AAG three houses could not be closed as scheduled. 

The mortgage holder requested to talk to a supervisor they were told it would to 24 hours before a supervisor would be available. I believe they were just stonewalling me. I would think that the payoff could be determined quickly. If I called a bank or credit union I could get the payoff of a loan while I was on the phone. Additionally, they said that the payoff would be as of XX/XX/2020. This means since the request was made on XX/XX/2020 that about 28 days of interest would be received by the mortgage company that they did not earn, in affect the broower was being charged a penalty for payoff the mortgage early. The mortgage papers said there would not be a penalty for early payoff. 

It appears to me that rAAG did not care about their customers and was charging them for service they did not receive.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX charges from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX were on my account. I did not see them til around the middle of XXXX due to the fact I do not use my credit card that often so didn't open my bill upon its arrival. My daughter who pays my bills immediately called the company and got them to close the account and issue new ones unfortunately they only issued one to her mine never came. That was the XXXX statement when we saw them closing date of XX/XX/2020. We called the company and talked to a XXXX on a conference call in the fraud department and he said there are other charges from a car rental I am assuming you have not been anywhere else would like me to get rid of those also and we said yes. So on the bill closing date of XX/XX/2020 the charges had been removed we had a new account and assumed everything was taken care of. Imagine our surprise when opening the new account bill dated closing date XX/XX/2020 there was a charge from XXXX rent a car in XXXX Fl for XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX posted to the account on XX/XX/XXXX. This time my daughter called the company and we did a conference call so they knew she could talk on my behalf and talked to a XXXX who assured me after explaining what was going on they were all removed and she kept saying its marked as fraud why is it there. What was confusing to us and no one can give us an answer on is how those charges were able to be put on our new account. So again we assumed it would be taken care of silly us upon opening the statement dated XX/XX/2020 it was still there so we called again on XX/XX/XXXX because we were able to be together in my daughter 's car spoke to a XXXX  in the fraud department who after hearing of our situation and veifying my information immediately put us on hold for 10 mins and then someone called XXXX got on the line and put me thru the 3rd degree asking me questions that no one had ever done to me before since I am XXXX I got a little confused and my daughter tried to help and the woman said he must answer where my daughter said well he won't know that answer because i don't even know that answer. Once she listened to us she said yes there is fraud i can see that my daughter said do you see the one from XX/XX/XXXX she said yes I will get it taken care of and we will change your account number and send you new cards. Unfortunately the XXXX statement came and the XXXX rent a car charges from Oklahoma have been removed they were XXXX but not the XX/XX/XXXX. So my daughter has now been checking it online and they have not yet removed the one from XXXX nor have they sent us new cards. We wrote a letter and sent it to them and have yet to hear from them and I will now be marking my statement disputed and only pay those charges that I owe. My daughter has locked the account so no one can use it also. In addition I will be reporting this mess to the Wisconsin Fraud dept if I can figure out where that is and may try the XXXX police department because it is definitely theft.

The thieves obtain the mail with card then unlock it and withdraw money on ATM. I have reported this incident and Identity Theft to XXXX police and IdentityTheft.gov. 
At last, CITI tells me that this withdrawal was made from your account with your Citibank Banking Card and refuse any reimbursement. The focus is the transaction is an unauthorized ( this card has been used without my permission ) instead of whether it is made from my account. 
These days, I contact custom service of CITI online bank and call servicing hotline. They refuse any reimbursement and offer any further explanations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
At all times relevant to this complaint, Budget Control Services , Inc. aka BC Services , Inc. ( hereinafter referred to as BC ), who has a principle place of business located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX . XXXX, XXXX, XXXX  XXXX violated Fair Debt Collections Practices Act.

BC alleges, claims and affirms through execution of a signed and sworn affidavit that XXXX was duly and properly served pursuant to C.R.C.C.P. Rule 304, concerning service of process of : Summons ; Complaint under Simplified Civil Procedure ; and Answer Under Simplified Civil Procedure. 

b. XXXX XXXX, who was acting as representative for and on behalf of BC alleges service of process was executed on XXXX on or about XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX XXXX hours. XXXX XXXX also claims to be a process server, and swore under oath, executed and signed a jurat,  under penalty of perjury, that he personally served XXXX at his place of residence. 

c. XXXX challenges and responds that this never happened. Not only this but XXXX was unaware of these proceeding until recently XX/XX/XXXX, but also the reason for such a claim. 

d. XXXX further contests this service of process as improper service as fraudulent, and not ever happening, and further asks this court to throw out said service of process. 

1 XXXX wishes to press charges for perjury ( falsifying a jurat ) against XXXX XXXX for lying under oath on an Affidavit. 

2 BC alleges in its complaint that XXXX had an unpaid medical balance of {$700.00} filed on XX/XX/XXXX. This issue was not brought to Schmidts attention until XX/XX/XXXX well over 1 year later. BC appears to be attempting to unjust enrichment from the interest as well as other fraudulent expenses. 

3 Also, worthy to note is the fact XXXX wrote a letter to BC asking for itemized billing statement on XX/XX/XXXX, claimed debt was $ XXXX their response it now shows an unpaid balance of {$250.00} with costs. XXXX has never made a payment to BC. 

4 Furthermore, XXXX has already satisfied this account by settling the outstanding debt in full at the doctors office prior to a XXXX performed in XX/XX/XXXX by the same medical staff. XXXX believes there is no debt left on this medical incident. 

5 XXXX recalls only one incident in which there was any legal issue in the entire fiscal year of XXXX. There was a subpoena issued by Colorado XXXX XXXX XXXX. Thusly, XXXX contends this case is based on fraudulent acts as XXXX has been in and out of hospitalizations from XXXX through XXXX on numerous occasions for medical XXXX  and treatments. 

6 XXXX will seek other legal remedies against BC and XXXX XXXX regarding this matter. Violation exist under FDCPA, Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, as well as other violations. 

Fraud, negligence, perjury. I never given an opportunity to argue my side, they claim I still owe but now a different amount, I've never paid them a dime, my account I already paid the vendor. There legal process server falsified ( perjured ) an affidavit. Service was more than a year ago from date of service before they notified me in writing.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/2020, my husband and I purchased a vacation package from XXXX, using our MasterCard issued by Synchrony Bank . The amount billed was {$2800.00}. In XX/XX/2020 we received the following email from XXXX  stating that they were canceling our reservations and were not going to refund our money : From : " XXXX Customer Service '' XXXX Date : XX/XX/2020 at XXXX XXXX EDT To : xxxxxxxxxxxx Subject : YOUR XXXX   CANCELLATION Dear Xxxxxxxxxx Please be advised that, due to the DO NOT TRAVEL alert issued by the US State Department due to Coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) threat we have cancelled your upcoming international trip. 

The Department of State advises U.S. citizens to avoid all international travel due to the global impact of COVID-19. 

Please note : XXXX paused operations on XX/XX/XXXX as this crisis was unfolding, so we ask that you please note the following changes to normal procedures : Your resort reservation will be cancelled automatically. All cancellation fees have been waived. You will need to speak to your credit card 's issuing bank for your options as a cardholder. If you wish to reschedule your stay to a later date, please do so directly with your selected resort, although we are of the understanding that many resorts in your selected area have temporarily suspended operations. 

If your vacation includes flights, your flight portion will be cancelled when the airline you have booked officially cancels your flight, or within the next seven days, whichever comes first. Each airline is handling this crisis differently, and refund policies are changing by the day. Again, speak to the airline about your options, and to your credit card 's issuing bank for your options as a cardholder. 

XXXX ID : XXXX Cancelled : XX/XX/2020 at XXXX XXXX Cancellation details for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX All Adults/All-Inclusive Resort Cancellation Penalty : None Cancellation details for XXXX XXXX XXXX Cancellation Penalty : Your flight will be non-refundable _____________________________________________________________ As the email states, we contacted our credit card company ( Synchrony Bank ) In XX/XX/2020 and filed a complaint with them. We received a letter from Synchrony dated XX/XX/2020, denying our refund request. Synchrony stated that the reason for denial was the sales transaction appears to be authorized by you and/or received by you. While it is true that we authorized this purchase, we never received any services because XXXX cancelled our reservations. On XX/XX/2020 we re-filed our complaint with Synchrony and faxed them a copy of the XX/XX/2020 email from XXXX It has been over 60 days since the second complaint was filed and still we have gotten nothing in writing from Synchrony regarding this second complaint. On XX/XX/2020 I spoke again to a customer service representative from Synchrony and she said our second complaint had been closed, although we have never received any formal notification of this closure, nor the results of their findings from this investigation. I was told on XX/XX/XXXX by the Synchrony representative that she would re-open the case. In summary, it has been over 120 days since our initial complaint filing with Synchrony Bank and we are still waiting on a resolution to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a Costco Citibank credit card. On this date I specifically and expressly opted-out of automatically renewing membership charges by expressing this to the Costco clerk and providing alternative payment. I received assurance that no charges would be posted on the account for membership fees. I obtained this card as an emergency line of credit due to a personal injury, and never used it. Additionally, during this time, I continued to receive promotional material from Costco and Citibank, which was typically unwanted and discarded. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, without my knowledge or consent, and in violation of our agreement, Costco charged me {$120.00} for membership. Because of my status as a XXXX XXXX and Citibank and Costco 's practice of sending useless and unsolicited promotional materials, I stopped opening mail from them sometime before this unauthorized transaction. 

Eventually, this unauthorized charge accumulated interest and late fees. At this point, Citibank apparently attempted to contact me via a phone number that is identified by XXXX or XXXX as originating from a spam number. The number left voicemails in the form via an automated system that uses a robotic voice and is commonly associated with scammers. Citi began sending billing statements that in no way indicated any importance or difference from promotional materials. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, Citi began calling from a different phone number that was not identified as spam - again using a robotic voice. When I spoke with their representative, I discovered that they were attempting to collect payment on the unauthorized transaction and fees and interest on that transaction. I requested that they send me copies of my billing statement. 

After receiving the copies and verifying that they were real, I called Costco to have the unauthorized charge removed on XX/XX/XXXX. The representative indicated that the unauthorized charge was removed and directed my call to Citibank to dispute the fees and interest. Upon talking with a Citibank representative, she informed me that the charges were " too old '' to remove over the phone, and that I would have to write a letter to a PO Box controlled by their disputes department in order to have the charges removed. I wrote the letter according to the instructions I was given and waited. 

I received no response to this letter from Citibank. Figuring they had long turnaround times, I continued to wait. Today, XX/XX/XXXX, a real person from Citibank called me for the first time. They informed me that I would be required to pay the full amount of the initial unauthorized charge plus interest and fees, totaling {$340.00}. I began calling their billing disputes department, which automatically disconnects your call after 2-3 minutes of waiting. After several failed attempts, I called customer service and demanded to speak to a billing disputes representative. Puzzlingly, they were in possession of the letter I was instructed to write, but had chosen not to provide a response. 

The representative informed me that the representative I spoke to on XX/XX/XXXX was actually incorrect, and that the charges were never eligible to be removed by their disputes process - not just interest and fees, but also the initial unauthorized transaction processed by Costco.  In the time between these calls, Citibank attempted to add several more interest charges and late fees, while I expected that my dispute was following some formal procedure for processing. The manager of  the disputes department that I spoke to indicated that the charges could never be removed on XX/XX/XXXX in the first place, however he simultaneously offered to remove charges that accumulated after XX/XX/XXXX. The manager stated that the actual purpose of my letter was to create a formal record of the fact that Citibank was not required to remove the charges ; however, I was never informed about this. Citibank is sending a 'corrected ' bill that rewinds back to XX/XX/XXXX, and is still likely to exceed {$250.00} for a transaction that was never authorized. 

Overall, Citibank is attempting to collect the full amount of this unauthorized charge veiled behind a non-transparent billing and collection process. The problem was further exacerbated by Citibank 's provision of inaccurate or outright false information about disputing charges. Citibank is using a complex web of bureaucracy to obscure the billing dispute process, leading to significant consumer harm in what amounts to strong-arm tactics. Citibank obscured their collection attempts for a duration long enough that I could not ever dispute the charges despite their unauthorized nature.

I purchased a house on XX/XX/XXXX and had my credit report ran previous to that date. Citibank terminates my cards prior to today XX/XX/XXXX. 
Their reasons were defined : " revolving balances are at or near credit limits ''. This is absolutely absurd. I have a credit limit for a reason. I am not over my limit, I am not exceeding. I am AT or NEAR the limit. 

This is completely discriminatory. This company approved my credit limits and are now cancelling me because I am *NEAR* the balances and they decide to cascade the information to me and leverage their poor " Fair Credit Reporting Act '' legalities and their absurd policies. This is not appropriate and is a horrible experience. Considering the 3 cards I had with Citi, only one was near the credit limit. The other two were fine. 

My revolving credit is generally LOW. 
I have LOW credit limits - purposely.

Consumer complaint narrative: I received a Netspend prepaid XXXX card as a XXXX  gift in XX/XX/XXXX. The purchase date is unknown. The person that gifted me the card did not include the cardholder agreement. Upon attempting to activate the card on the Netspend website on XX/XX/XXXX, I was given an error message and instructed to call the customer service line. Upon making contact with a customer service agent, I was informed the card expired on XX/XX/XXXX. The card states it is " GOOD THRU XX/XX/XXXX '', which I pointed out to the agent, who informed me the card has a 120 day expiration ( she did not explain what the expiration was or why it expired ) and the date on the card is the shelf life of the card. When I informed her the card was never activated and there was no indication of an expiration date on the card, I was told I could be issued a check but a {$4.00} fee would be deducted from the card. I requested the fee be removed as there was no indication on the card itself of any fees or expiration dates associated with the card. She told me there was no way to remove the fee, so I asked to speak with a supervisor. She informed me I could not speak with a supervisor as everyone was taking calls and the supervisor would not be able to assist with removing the fee. I asked her to put me on hold to wait for a supervisor and instead of being put on hold I was rerouted to enter my card number for activation. I entered my card number and received a message that my card was invalid and the call disconnected. After the call ended I searched the website for a cardholder agreement and was unable to determine which cardholder agreement was associated with my card, as there were many options but no indication of how to find the long form ID that would indicate which agreement to choose. There is nothing on the website to show there are expiration dates associated with card activation or that the date on the card is the shelf life. All I request is to receive the full {$50.00} amount I was gifted.

The address they have on file is not ours anymore. I do not think the hospital sent me any letters but from XXXX I have been out of state in XXXX  XXXX  and I've been moving around craiglist to craiglist and even had to set up a PO Box because my mom was being so difficult and not communicating with my mail. I can show evidence to prove all this. She eventually divorced my dad and the address has been sold since XXXX. However I do not think the XXXX XXXX had sent me anything directly anyway I think they just sent it to the collections agency. 

I have been trying to fix my credit and recently set up an XXXX account last year. I have also been working with XXXX XXXX, who also had access to my reports. Anyway It showed I had a collection item for {$900.00} with the California Business Bureau, and it showed it was from XXXX  XXXX hospital. When I called them they said they charged me interested of {$550.00} also which is a balance of {$1400.00}. 

Two representatives were really rude, last week I spoke to a girl called XXXX and she kept harrassing me and assaulting and never letting me finish my sentences. I was happy to pay the {$900.00} despite being laid off and in the tough times of COVID but she was so defiant and said no you knew about this, you made a payment in XXXX, we have been mailing you. Despite me explaining my story she was continuously attacking me. It was disgusting. I then spoke to XXXX, their supervisor yesterday, but she was just as rude saying I can offer you {$1200.00} lump sum payment, but this bill is from XXXX and its XXXX now, I know Covid has hit but you should have no excuse to pay this for now because you should have money saved for this? Are these people XXXX  XXXX? Do they know that Governor XXXX has imposed strict guidelines to ensure that people won't be evicted, so that companies can not harrass them for payments and companies are meant to be compassionate during Covid? I was so angry at her. 

Anyway I want you to acknowledge the following unreasonable and harrassing behaviour of the company - I have been happy to settle with the original amount, I have been trying to contact the hospital directly but they aren't responding. From my understanding medical bills are ineffective after 7 years and this is from XXXX but the collections agency has made this effective from XXXX - I want them to acknowledge that I haven't been aware about this bill, I have been moving around, they can see that from my report I have evidence that my mom is abusive and doesnt help me, and you can see they sold the house in XXXX. They can not express how I knew about this bill and am liable to pay. 
- We are protected in law for any forms of harrassment. The fact that I am willing to pay {$900.00} for something is still a trait of good behaviour, at least appreciate that! The communications back and forth about how I knew about the bill, I am apparently a liar, the fact that its a XXXX bill and I've left this till XXXX to try and make me feel guilty is appauling, these people need to know that the Law is in our favour when it comes to delaying bills and from any forms of harrassment. 

I hope you can look into the bahaviour of this company.

On or around XX/XX/2020 I submitted an online application for a XXXX XXXX  credit card underwritten by Wells Fargo Bank. Part of the process they require authentication of ID by a third party application. This application seldom works correctly. Finally, after many attempts, it did work. 

I filled out the application completely and accurately and submitted it online. After about a minute of " processing '', I was given a telephone number to call. I called and the Wells Fargo employee stated that they can see the application and the full details, but yet they did not receive the application. There is nothing they can do, she stated. 

I used a different computer and again applied. Again, their third-party ID verification system didn't work correctly until the fourth attempt. Finally they were able to verify my ID and I complete and submitted my application. The same thing happened again. I was instructed to call. I called and the same story about how they see my application and see the data I filled out, but they didn't receive the application. 

She said my only alternative was to go to a XXXX XXXX store. 

I attempted to contact Wells Fargo via XXXX, but they seldom respond coherently. 

This is not the first time I have been involved with Wells Fargo XXXX incompetence. I believe they are simply refusing to accept applications for some illegal motive or they are simply incompetent to set up their application system and / or handle problems when they arise.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
A few months ago, Citibank changed their web site. I have a Citi checking account and 2 Citi credit cards. Previously when you view your Card details and click on the Make a Payment button, it displayed the Citi checking account and the user could easily make a payment. You could still set up additional payment accounts. Currently it directs you to a payment setup page that allows selecting a bank ( Citi itself isn't listed on the default page ) or manually entering account details. It no longer provides your existing Citi accounts. You could search and find Citibank among the supported banks. However, the web site is malfunctioning. 

On XX/XX/2020 I attempted to make a payment from my Citi checking account to one of my credit cards. After entering my Citi credentials, it not only wasn't pulling up the Citi account but was also logging me off from the Citi web site completely. I tried a few times, with different browsers and had the same result. Finally I entered my routing and account numbers manually and processed a payment. I was not notified of any problem at that time or during the following week. On XX/XX/2020 I checked my account and noticed a Returned Check fee of {$29.00} and after reviewing my transactions I realized the payment did not go through. I had the same issues processing a payment but was able to use the Transfer option ( which is not at all intuitive or prominent ) to successfully pay my card. 

In addition to the {$29.00} late fee, Citi also charged me interest of {$6.00} and then {$8.00} next month, both of which as a result of the failed payment. I called Citi and they refused to refund either the late fee or the interest charges. 

This leaves me with the impression that Citi intentionally made their web site more difficult to use in order to generate additional revenue from fees.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Home Depot att Mr. XXXX Re : Deceptive billing practices From : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Sir, I wanted to write you to expose a huge deceptive practice I have recently encountered when looking into my Home Depot account. 



When I got my bill and saw the minimum payment I set up my XXXX XXXX XXXX online banking to pay my monthly payment to home Depot. In fact I paid an amount in excess of the minimum. Once I had this set up I did not visit your billing since I was on autopay. As luck would have it, I needed to check on one of my purchases. Well did I get a surprise and not a good one. 

I opened my statement and to my surprise I saw an interest charge. How could that be : I have set up auto pay, I was paying more than required. This was very disturbing to me so I called to follow up. 

What I learned was really bad!!! 

So even though the statement showed I had no payment due I was directed to the SMALL PRINT outside the billing information box. There I was advised is the reason for the interest charge and I was introduced to Promotional billing and Revolving charge billing. 

That is a highly deceptive process..statement shows nothing due and then the cleverly disguised revolving charges due. 

THAT IS AT BEST LESS THAN TRANSPARENT AND MORE ACCURATELY SMELLS OF OUTRIGHT DECEPTION. 

WHY NOT BE HONEST AND SEND 2 SEPARATE STATEMENTS : A-PROMOTIONAL BILLING B-REVOLVING PURCHASE BILLING I would like to hear your side of the story before I seek help of FINRA or other oversight agency. 



As a regular customer this is very, very upsetting. I will await your reply. 



XXXX XXXX XXXX acct # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Driven by Excellence! 

SERVING WITH INTEGRITY! 

XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2020 I signed up for a prepaid newspaper service with the XXXX  XXXX XXXX at the XXXX XXXX  XXXX in XXXX XXXX, KS. The representative selling the paper stated this was a prepaid subscription and that it would not be auto renewed. I confirmed this a second time before I handed over my debit card for payment. I began receiving my paper with no issues, but I realized I didn't want to renew as the paper was not substantial enough to justify the cost. 
I had forgotten when the delivery was set to expire, but I received an email from the XXXX  XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2020 stating that my subscription had expired on XX/XX/2020. The email also stated " We value you as a subscriber and hate to see you go. Renew your subscription today. '' I received several phone calls in the following months requesting that I renew my service. I declined each time. I was never informed during these calls that my service had continued or that I owed any money. I have never received a paper bill from the XXXX  XXXX XXXX. 
On XX/XX/2020, I received a letter from A.R.M. Solutions attempting to collect a debt of {$22.00} for their customer the XXXX XXXX XXXX. I emailed the XXXX XXXX at their request per the recording on the customer service phone line on XX/XX/2020. I requested the debt be removed as I had never received a bill nor was my service supposed to auto renew. I also included the email that showed my subscription had expired XX/XX/2020. I received a response to that email today, XXXX XXXX, that apologized for the inconvenience, but stated that I owe them the money. 
I viewed the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX site for the XXXX  XXXX XXXX and have found that this business has a pattern of predatory billing practices that often result in customer 's having to lodge complaints to obtain correction. I am disturbed that I can be reported to a collection agency for a debt that was never billed. If the XXXX XXXX had my address and my phone number to request renewals, it is perplexing to understand how I did not receive a bill. In addition, it appears the XXXX 's sales representatives repeatedly lie to consumers to get them to sign up for the service. I wonder why the XXXX can not take the same decisive action against its own employees that it takes against its " valued subscribers. ''

I had to call each month to make a payment bc they don't allow any transactions. After my third call they changed it and had to explain my account is in forbearance. Others around me my neighbors have FHA loans and they moved 3 to 6 missed payments to their mortgage balance. MT Bank doesn't do that. I just had a call yesterday and there was no message left. 
My husband is out of a job so its frustrating using all our savings bc were too afraid of MT Bank. They don't want to help us at all. You don't qualify for nothing. Consumer complaint narrative:
What happened? 
I am in very bad financial shape stemming from a very bad employment situation I suffered, and am still suffering at the hands of my ex- employer XXXX that left me in financial ruin, and now I have XXXX XXXX XXXX trying to further ruin me with there aggressive collection tactics and complete disregard for the physical, emotional, and psychological toll I am enduring. The nature of my complaint involved a very aggressive debt collector named " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' whom bought two accounts, for the purpose of this compliant it will be specifically about my SYNCHRONY account. However a second complaint will be filed with regards to my other account with them. In 2017 I started working with a local automotive parts manufacture here in town called XXXX while I was enrolled in college full time. This job really left me in financial ruin, as slowly my wages were not being paid to me. Sadly, the fact that I was left without wages and the owner would string me along and promise to pay me " next week, next month '' etc, I continued to work without pay expecting to eventually receive my wages. Because I was not getting paid, my credit cards and other bills went into default. One of those is this debt XXXX XXXX bought from XXXX. I have been engaged in a 2 year legal battle with XXXX and it's owners. I have a case with the California Department of Labor and have had multiple hearings and a trial where I was awarded by the court my past due wages. I have attached the court declarations and the complaint against XXXX, so you can read first hand the nightmare I've been through. I even lost my dear Dog because I was unable to pay his continued veterinary treatment. However this judgement awarding me my past due wages has been impossible to collect, and even though I have a court order for XXXX to pay me, I have not received any monies and the situation looks extremely unlikely I will see a XXXX out of this due to the company being now investigated by the Local District Attorney 's office, and they have an F rating on the XXXX  so they have zero chance of actually getting new clients. I am attaching the proof of the D.A investigation and a copy of the XXXX profile so you can see. I have implored XXXX to really help me with this, but instead they just transfer me to there " legal department '' like i'm supposed to be some kind of criminal. I hope once they see the proof of my terrible situation they will be more willing to work with me. I do not appreciate them making legal threats against me, when I'm simply just trying to resolve my account. they are impossible to negotiate with and I just hope these facts helps them help me pay this off at a reduced amount, and stop threatening me with legal action when I am not refusing to pay.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I applied for and received a credit card from U S Bank, called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The enticement that caused me to apply for the card was this : " Save an additional XXXX cents per gallon of fuel FOR ONE YEAR each time you redeem 100 fuel points ''. 
XXXX, via their customer reward card, gives 10 fuel points for every qualified {$100.00}. spent in their store. The points can be used to reduce the cost of gas at XXXX XXXX stations. 
on multiple occasions, I used more than 100 fuel points but did not receive the " additional '' earned reward points promised by US Bank Master Card. For example, on XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased XXXX gas and used 200 of my 266 fuel points. I received 25 additional points, making my discount {$.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased XXXX gas and used 500 of my 516 fuel points, and received a discount of {$.00}. 
According to the promise of the card, I should have received ( in the first example ) a discount of {$.00} ( additional 50 points for 200 XXXX fuel points ). In the second example I should have received 500 additional fuel points in addition to my XXXX points, making my discount {$1.00}. 
As I read and understand their own written words, I am not receiving what I had expected upon applying for their mastercard.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I called and negotiated over several months to pay the Balance in full. The original loan amount was with Reliable Credit Association in the amount of {$2000.00}. I was incarcerated and have been struggling the last couple of years and through Covid to get my finances in order. We mutually agreed on {$1800.00} as payment in full. I asked for confirmation of the agreement before I made the payment and they advised me that they did not have a way to send me a confirmation of the agreement but that I would recieve a reciept stating a XXXX bal due and that payment had been received for payment in full. I recieved a Receipt in the mail dated for XX/XX/2020 with a remaining balance of {$1300.00}. It did not have the amount of my payment listed. 

The letter said : For : Reliable Credit Association Bal XXXX Agency Accnt # : XXXX Creditor Accnt # XXXX Thank you for your payment. You will find your current balance above. 

This company said that if I made the payment of {$1800.00} I would be released from any further liability of the debt and that collection efforts would stop and my credit report would be updated accordingly to reflect the debt was settled for less than the amount owed. This company did not live up to their end of the bargain. They committed Fraud to entice me to make a large payment that took up all of my accumulated savings to settle this account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo Home Mortgage, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Iowa signed my mortgage note as " Pay to the Order of Wells Fargo Home Mortgage '' after or soon after I signed the Mortgage note on XX/XX/XXXX without my knowledge, disclosure to me or preauthorization to me, Giving Wells Fargo Home Mortgage a letter of Credit with my signature. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage has presumed I have gifted Wells Fargo Home Mortgage all of my rights away in consideration of Wells Fargo Home Mortgages promissory note created by my energy and my credit to them. 

Misrepresentation : Wells Fargo Home Mortgage lack of disclosure and violations in Truth in Lending Act 1. Wells Fargo Home Mortage did not confirm that I was accessing my own credit, which actually derives from me. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage is simply keeping a record of my payments and that's all they are instructed to do. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage is an investment company and invests all mortgage payments by customers. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage Foreclosed on the subject property when I was applying for a modification. I confronted Wells Fargo Home Mortgage in written form that I was the creditor and Wells Fargo Home Mortgage was the Borrower and they were accessing my credit to make a falsified contract obligation. As soon as I faxed this document to Wells Fargo Home Mortgage, Wells Fargo Home Mortgage started foreclosure proceedings with a 3rd Party Debt collector attorney in Michigan Named : XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX Michigan. Foreclosure date XX/XX/XXXX and deferred until XX/XX/XXXX. 

2. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage did not disclose, inform or notify me in any way that I was accessing my own credit that actually derives from me and Wells Fargo Home Mortgage is only keeping a record of it.

3. Wells Fargo did not disclose that they would keep the note when I repay the note/loan.

4. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage did not state that they would sell the note. Which they did sell at least one time several days or weeks after I applied my signature to the note. 
XXXX. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage did not state that once they sold the note they were going to apply the funds to the loan and that they were going to keep the funds themselves, thereby enjoying unjust enrichment.

6. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage did not state that they were going to insure the note, thereby creating a conflict of interest whereupon it is in their best interests that I do not pay.

7. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage did not state by depositing the note that I was providing them with an implied Power of Attorney and doing things on my behalf without my knowledge, or consent by my signature. 

8. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage did not disclose that they would benefit from XXXX, using my property for profit and gain. 
9. Photocopies are being used for an alleged obligation or a liability. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage did not disclose the number of photocopies on hand. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage never produced the original Note of Obligations with Wet Ink Signature upon numerous times requiring Original Note of Obligation. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage ignored my numerous requests for Original Wet Ink Signature Obligation. 
10. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage failed and refused to provide me proof of claim of an Obligation of indebtedness to them when I asked them to provide it per the Qualified Written Request Dated XX/XX/XXXX. 
11. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage proceeded to provide me with an obligation of interest to another customer 's alleged debt with the account number, address of the alleged property, and name of the customer who was requesting the same proof of claim as me. Why was WFHM sending me this information, account number, and address of another customer requesting the same information, proof of claim, to me? 
12. Wells Fargo Home Mortgage made unauthorized withdrawals from my checking account without my permission, signature, and entitlement. 

Wells Fargo Home Mortgage employees, CEOs and their Trustees have and are committing Bank Fraud : 1. Misrepresentation 2. Inducement 3. Concealment 4 Theft 5. Extortion/Menaces/Duress Exponential Violations of the " Truth in Lending Act. ''

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I received a phone call and a text from Citibank inquiring as to whether I had recently attempted to charge {$930.00} for clothing. I had not. I spoke with a Citibank representative on the phone and explicitly stated that neither I nor my husband, who also has a card, had attempted to make this charge. The representative assured me that all was well and that the charge would not appear on my account. On the XXXX, I looked at my account online and saw that the {$930.00} charge was pending. It appeared that my existing account was closed and another account was being created. On XX/XX/XXXX I looked at the account online again and saw that the {$930.00} charge had been posted to my account. I had a credit balance because of a reimbursement for unused airline tickets, and the {$930.00} had been deducted from the credit balance. There was no indication that the charge was an illegitimate charge. I disputed the charge online and received a text from Citi stating that I would be receiving a new credit card. On XX/XX/XXXX I called Citibank and spoke with six different representatives. Even though I explained several times that the bank had identified the charge as illegitimate and presumably had denied it, I was unable to get the {$930.00} restored to my account. Representatives insisted that I had not been charged although clearly I had. A print-out of the online account status is attached. The last person I spoke with told me that an investigation was underway and that the credit card company had a process that they were following. I have received nothing in writing about this charge from Citi either online or by mail. I have requested that the account be closed and that the credit balance be refunded to me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I leased a XXXX XXXX XXXX and returned it at lease end. I did the lease-end inspection prior to returning the vehicle to Hyundai. I paid all of the lease installments with no problems. 
One day I received credit alerts from my XXXX XXXX " credit-wise ''. I looked it up and found out that Hyundai-finance reported that I was 30 days late on my lease-end bill which I never received and only heard about it through the credit bureau reporting. I know that there is a bill that will come any day but never received one. 
The day I heard about the late filing I searched my email and did not see any Hyundai emails. I went to my account online to see if there is a bill but there are no bills/invoices listed at all. Attached is a screenshot from my account. 
By the way, my account is still showing an old bill from XX/XX/XXXX that was paid on time. See the attached payment record. 

I called Hyundai immediately and paid the invoice in full. I asked if they can adjust the negative reporting but they said I have to mail them a request. I mailed my request to the Hyundai dispute department on XX/XX/XXXX but never heard back from them. 
I went on my XXXX account and disputed the negative reporting but never heard back from Hyundai.

Today, I see that they added a 60 days late payment into my credit report. 
My question to Hyundai is, how come I never received a bill from you or your collection department and now I am late in payments that I've never been late on? 
I believe it is my right as a consumer to be given an invoice with billing date and due date. 
Attached are *Account details screenshot. 
*Account payment proof for the payment still showing on the account which is dated XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX A letter that I sent to Hyundai credit dispute department * A letter from Hyundai showing the account paid in full.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I used Synchrony 's online website to apply for a credit limit increase to a card that I have been faithfully paying roughly double the minimum monthly payment on, which was denied. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a paper billing statement as well as a notification of review of my account ( dated XX/XX/XXXX ) where I was told my account had been reviewed and Synchrony was decreasing my credit limit from {$1500.00} down to {$250.00}. I called immediately to find out why and was told my account had been reviewed and my credit score wasn't high enough. The letter containing my notice of a lowered credit line also states that my credit score was XXXX at the time of sending, but on Synchrony 's own website where it tracks your credit score, as well as using XXXX XXXX 's application, it shows my credit score was XXXX. So now by lowering my credit limit, it is also decreasing my credit score and they are using that to say I lack the creditworthiness of my original {$1500.00} limit ( of which I am never late ). Also, they are either reporting credit wrong, or using wrong data to support lowering credit limits, which in turn they are using to create worse credit scores, in perpetuity for an excuse. I am currently preparing to buy my first house, and as my credit score trends upward, lowering someones credit limit in order to generate a lower credit score then deny their creditworthiness is patently unfair, and makes me look like a bad borrower. When I called asking my credit limit to be returned to what it was, they said they could only do that by running a limit increase again XXXX of which I was denied, and they would not tell me why. ) As of the time my credit limit increase was processed, my score is currently XXXX XXXX XXXX ) and XXXX ( Synchrony ) reporting. Consumer complaint narrative: Our loan was sold to Freedom Mortgage and at the time of the sale we noticed a {$700.00} increase in our payment. Next and to make matters WAY worse, they re-evaluated our escrow and submitted a tax code that included the taxes for the ENTIRE building not just our unit. Our new tax bill was {$53000.00} a year on a condo we paid under {$200000.00} for. This equals {$4000.00} a month. We are able to pay what we are supposed to but refuse to pay for two insurance policies ( we have always paid through our association ) and the taxes -- I don't even know where to begin with this issue. I am so desperate I am actually considering selling the condo we love to get out from this nightmare.
