Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased a NetSpend card on XX/XX/2020 and loaded XXXX cash onto it at A XXXX store in XXXX, Texas. I am travelling and needed to book hotel rooms online. Upon registering the card, I first got a message that said, your funds will be available but we will not accept direct deposits until you furnish verify your identity. I did not want direct deposit and I called the number on the back of the card, I went through a series of questions about my relatives, my former addresses and associates. My account was unlocked and I charged a hotel for one night on XX/XX/XXXX and the next morning, my account was locked and the funds in it were inaccessible. The Risk Manager department at Netspend told me it's because they could not confirm my identity. I already had on the phone as is their verification method that I am familiar with, this wasn't my first card with them, so they had a lot of information stored and I confirmed that with them through questioning. Since I'm traveling, I do not have my Social Security card with me and they told me that I will be REQUIRED to submit 3 forms of ID -1 state ID, one Social Security card and proof of address. 
The Social Security Administration office is closed due to pandemic to all in person appointments and I was made aware that the only way I can obtain a new copy of my SSN card at this time is by putting my State ID in the mail to the SS Administration. I can not do that. I can not be without ID and that's unreasonable and unsafe! 
I am now living behind a shopping center, I lost my job, because I could not appear due to my funds being frozen. All because NetSpend is denying that My Money is My Money ... Not theirs, mine! 
I am going on a crusade against NetSpend. A warning label should be put on their sealed package that states, " Warning, do not load this card if you need your money. '' If they want to now require people 's Social Security Card, they should be a proper bank and lending institution, then, they should be required to ask for that at point of sale ... Before loading money on to card!!!! 
I see they have done this to hundreds of thousands of people and were ordered by the courts to refund XXXX XXXX dollars to cunsumers that they have done this exact thing to a few years ago but they are still doing the exact same thing. You would think they would have changed, perhaps that XXXX XXXX was a drop in the bucket compared to what benefits they get through inflating their valuation. 
I can not even get home to get a returned check because, as I said, I am now jobless and penniless thanks to Netspend, I have lost my home and am in danger of XXXX. I have a good lawsuit and a video log off the harm and damage they have caused me. 
Under the statutes which govern who has the right to require a Social Security Card for ID, only employers and lending institutions fall under that category and they are neither. They are not even a bank Please please help me!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Choice Recovery , Inc. has directly reported negative information to all 3 credit bureaus without ever sending me any form of notice.

I was never given the opportunity to confirm or deny the debt, nor has this company ever contacted me regarding this.

I am absolutely disgusted that they would treat me as an uneducated consumer.

FDCPA laws are very clear and I should not have to quote them for Choice Recovery and this negative information should be deleted from all 3 credit files immediately.

809. Validation of debts ( a ) Notice of debt ; contents Within five days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing -- ( 1 ) the amount of the debt ; ( 2 ) the name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector ; ( 4 ) a statement that if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, the debt collector will obtain verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment against the consumer and a copy of such verification or judgment will be mailed to the consumer by the debt collector ; and ( 5 ) a statement that, upon the consumer 's written request within the thirty-day period, the debt collector will provide the consumer with the name and address of the original creditor, if different from the current creditor.

( b ) Disputed debts If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) of this section that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall ce
ase collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector. Collection activities and communications that do not otherwise violate this subchapter may continue during the 30-day period referred to in subsection ( a ) unless the consumer has notified the debt collector in writing that the debt, or any portion of the debt, is disputed or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor. Any collec
tion activities and communication during the 30-day period may not overshadow or be inconsistent with the disclosure of the consumers right to dispute the debt or request the name and address of the original creditor.

I thereafter had to obtain a certified statement from my bank along with the cancelled checks issued directly from my bank to confirm that the payments were received by LoanCare, that I was not in default, and had no late fees. Additionally, they have begun improperly assessing late fees to my account again. I have advised LoanCare of this extraordinary burden, that i have been assessed additional fees by my tax accountant as a result of these delays, and that I am not able to file my XXXX taxes due to these delays. Lastly, LoanCare initiated and granted forbearance request for my account when I have never request one. When I told LoanCare to remove the forbearance, advised that I never made a request either in writing, by phone call or any other manner, they advised that they were not sure why someone initiated the request on my account as they did not have a record of me making the request. 

This servicer does not keep and maintain accurate business records, refuses to timely address or address at all the errors with their business records for the accounts they service, and places the consumers at an extreme unfair disadvantage due to their failing and negligent business practices.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Near the end of XXXX of XX/XX/XXXX, we were put on this loan modification trial period. 
This was not a modification that we requested or signed up for. In fact, to this day I still have no idea how we were placed on this modification, because the loan servicing company handling the account for the Mortgage company, has refused to this date to explain how we were placed on this Modification trial period. A Modification that had us paying roughly {$300.00} dollars less then our normal Mortgage payment amount of {$1900.00} At the time we were 2 payments behind after catching up from being further behind because of late Worker '' s Compensation payments. 

We were told that more information would be forthcoming, which never happened. At no time did we ever receive in writing any information that explained the whole process or what the modification would look like. Which I complained about in calls to the company during the whole modification process, from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX I just kept being told that they were coming soon. What I did finally receive was final paperwork to finalized the modification, that I was never told was coming as I had not agreed to anything nor did I apply for the modification. They just expected us to blindly sign up for a modification that we never requested or knew anything about. A modification that we were without prior knowledge or intent placed upon. 
XXXX ofXX/XX/XXXX was the payment trial period and at the end of that trial period for the months of XXXX and XXXX RoundPoint Mortgage Servicing absolutely refused to take a Mortgage payment over the phone or online. I finally just wound up mailing one payment in that took a month for them to process causing more late fees. Late fees that I was charged during the modification process as well for the regular Mortgage payments because of the process that they placed us on and by refusing the payments it put us further behind. 

When we did not sign the paperwork that was sent and had notarized, 1.  ) because we had absolutely no idea what we were signing up for, because we were never given any written information about what the modification was, prior to receiving the final paperwork, how long the modification was for, the interest rate what the modification entailed and so forth. 2. ) We were never notified that the paperwork was coming and it was the XXXX XXXX holiday, nor were we told that it had to be notarized before hand. though I was told after wards that someone attempted to call, there was no voicemail left, as no one ever left a voicemail, nor followed up by email as was requested, due to to treatment schedule for the injury I sustained. We also found out later that we had other options open to us that were never discussed or addressed as options nor would they discuss other options, especially since we NEVER APPLIED for the MODIFICATION in the first place. 

When we, as it was put " failed to sign '' the agreement that we never applied for, in order to go through the modification again, we had to turn in all this paperwork to get approved to be accepted for a modification that WE never filled out before. 
Now with the refusal to accept our Mortgage payments and the lower payments, which were not going to be our new payment, it was suppose to be roughly {$150.00} higher then the trial payment, we were now even further behind on our mortgage payments. 

Once I filled out the paperwork that was emailed to me I asked for an Address to mail it to, which they refused and insisted that I upload it to the computer and email it back. So I did on XX/XX/XXXX to the loss mitigation email address and to XXXX XXXX XXXX email. A little over a week went by and no word, so I called RoundPoint and talked to XXXX XXXX who told me that she could not find the paperwork and had me resend it to her, which at first we were having issue as the attachments being sent were not uploading properly on their end. The paperwork was sent by email multiple times XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX. Nobody giving me the Physical address to send the paperwork to and in fact XXXX told me that if I did, it would only start the process over again and delay it further. After this there was still no answer and took another three calls to find out that the application had been closed because they were missing paperwork that I did not know was missing because I was not told and through this time of process no one called to tell me or sent me any notice that anything was missing and after talking for more then an hour to this older XXXX american man in his late XXXX XXXX to early XXXX XXXX  who went through countless emails and notes told me finally that one page did not come through and told me what it was, which turned out to be a second income statement which was my XXXX payment which was identical to the second one that did process. since it was closed I had to start it over again, but in the meantime the foreclosure process was started. A process that never should have happened in the first place had someone not placed us without our knowledge or consent placed us on in the first place. 

Now here we are again with out the necessary information about the modification because it was mot sent prior to payment trial period and was not received until a week before the final payment, XX/XX/XXXX. The new copy that was sent was still not legible, as all the characters in the font that was used was smashed together like XXXX example : theendofthe ) some of the characters were even overlapping. It was then copied and pasted in a text, but upon reading, I noticed that sentences were not complete and RoundPoint was notified in writing onXX/XX/XXXX after I had contacted the Mortgage Company, XXXX XXXX and explained the issues I was having with their servicing company Roundpoint and how on XX/XX/XXXXI had in writing contacted RoundPoint and told them about the issue with the email from them and requested a new copy and how it took another 2 months. They have played middleman but do not want to get more involved than that because of the complaints filed about Roundpoint. Again they are trying to push through paperwork that we have not agreed to and know that we have other option which we have yet to receive the documentation that we not only requested but are also entitled to by law. 

1. ) I requested just after we found out that we had gone into foreclosure, the amounted needed to stop the foreclosure and was told it would take several days and up to a week to compile and then they would get back to us. DID NOT Happen nor did we receive in a statement to be mailed to us. That number was never supplied to us and we are still waiting. 
2. ) I requested that and KNOW that this is one of the available options, if we could get the back payments caught up what payments for the modification would look like. Have not received anything 3. ) I have requested the cash out option amount as my Worker 's Compensation case is coming to a close. Have not received. 
4. ) Requested loan modification details in writing through the mail as I will not accept another emailed copy. Last sent XX/XX/XXXX through the Mortgage Company XXXX XXXX and informed them that I still have not received that paper work as of XX/XX/XXXX, when I contacted them again about the issue and it was forwarded to the Servicing company by my main contact, XXXX XXXX, a Supervisor at XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ho has also informed her Direct Supervisor. 

The next issue is that since I was missing one document that I did not know about and the modification application that I filed for the first time was canceled because of missing income. But that the current application was accepted even though I was missing a piece of information that they requested, Yet between the two applications I filed a complaint against them, which they closed after accepting this application and never addressing the complaint and even went so far as to saying they needed more time to address and actually closed it 2 weeks early after the application was accepted and the individual handling the complaint, XXXX XXXX, was no longer employed by RoundPoint Mortgage Servicing.

I would like for CItibank to remedy this situation so that I can continue to improve my credit score. They are intentionally hurting my ability to improve my credit rating.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Near the end of XXXX, I reached out to Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing to inquire about mortgage payment options on our personal home since we rely on income from our two rental properties. It was possible, in the near future, that our tenants may have difficulty paying rent and we wanted to know our options. I called the main phone number and reached a customer service representative. I was told that Shellpoint could not give me any options unless I filled out the online form. I filled out the form and waited for a response. Over the next few days I completed more research and realized that forbearance only put off the payments until the end of the forbearance period. This type of plan would not help me. I decided to not pursue any mortgage options through Shellpoint.

To my surprise, I received a letter from Shellpoint dated XX/XX/2020 stating that we were enrolled in the forbearance plan. I did not agree to that. On XX/XX/2020 I called my point of contact, but I could not get through and the mailbox was full. I called again on XX/XX/2020, XX/XX/2020 and XX/XX/2020 to get the forbearance cancelled and the automatic payments started again. 
This, in it itself, wouldn't have been such a problem except that I was going through a refinance of my personal home at the same time. The new lender saw the " affected by natural disaster '' on my credit report and required additional documentation, assurances and time to evaluate. This credit report verbiage is code for Covid-19-related issues and the new lender was concerned about our ability to repay the loan. That verbiage should never have been on our credit reports and has resulted in payments of {$5100.00} in loan lock extension fees. 
I'm including XXXX documents. The first XXXX is the original loan estimate for the new mortgage loan on our personal home. It shows the lender credits as {$10000.00}. The second document is the closing disclosure showing the lender credits as {$5300.00}. The difference in lender credits is due to loan lock extension fees. The third document is a letter I wrote to the new lender explaining why our XXXX loan was erroneously placed into forbearance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing on behalf of my wife 's Amazon Prime Store Credit Card by Synchrony Bank. Twice this year, I had made an early payment which means I paid off the entire balance before I receive the statement at the end of the month. I want to help my wife build her credit, by paying on time and paying off the entire balance each month. 
We have XXXX young children including a newborn just XXXX XXXX XXXX, every time when my wife wants to purchase something on Amazon Prime, she would go and see how much available credit she has on her Amazon Prime Store Credit Card, and we would budget from there, just recently we had paid off a balance of {$380.00}, so we can purchase an item, knowing her credit limit is only {$400.00}. 
This is the second time this year, Sychrony decided to lock/hold down the account, the customer service rep, say the funds are held for six business day. The funds were withdrawn from our checking account, but Synchrony wont credit the account and release the funds of {$400.00} Total Credit Limit for us to use on Amazon Prime. 
My wife is fairly new to credit, we had not missed any payments on the account, but there were a few times, when we didn't pay off the entire balance, so I had a remaining balance, but most of the time payments were made on time, because my wife likes to shop on Amazon Prime. The first time I called and complained to Synchrony Bank, the representative said it was a " red flag '', that we pay off the entire balance at the end of each month, but still wouldn't release the funds, so we can go and shop again on Amazon prime. 
Most banks, once payment is made, funds can be used again after twenty four to thirty six hours, but Synchrony bank, likes to hold the funds for six days after payment is made, which means we can not use the account, which is really inconvenient for us. 
Also I would like to mention Synchrony Bank originally gave my wife {$1100.00} Total credit limit and all of a sudden decided to lower the limit to {$400.00} without any explanation despite my wife 's credit history

I went out of my way to make that payment amidst the worst part of the coronavirus outbreak in XXXX. In fact, I contacted ShellPoint and NewRez in regards to coronavirus induced hardship multiple times, in writing, starting on or about XX/XX/XXXX. My requests were first ignored and then reduced to 3 months forbearance. The three months forbearance was approved on XX/XX/XXXX. Please refer to their initial email sent to me on XX/XX/XXXX stating that the forbearance was approved. ( See attached Exhibit 1 ) 2. Despite of the fact that Ive never missed a single payment, Shellpoint/ NewRez charged me a fee of {$7300.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. My payment history is as following : XX/XX/XXXX received on XX/XX/XXXX ( due XX/XX/XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX received on XXXX XXXX ( due XX/XX/XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX received on XXXX XXXX ( due XX/XX/XXXX ) ( See Exhibit 2 ) So why does Shellpoint/NewRez is charging me {$7300.00} due on XX/XX/XXXX? ( As I was explained, that was a forbearance request fee which I found to be outrageous. I took a screenshot of their website that clearly shows my last timely payment made on XX/XX/XXXX due ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and shows a payment due of {$7300.00} on XX/XX/XXXX ) ( see attached exhibit 3 ) 3. Shellpoint/NewRez provided NO plausible explanation as to why they offered and promised ( confirmed by email ) the payments on forbearance are to be paid off at the end of the loan in a lump sum. and then failed to add it to the written agreement upon my multiple requests in writing ( see my original complaint ). 
4. D. XX/XX/XXXX communication and email to XXXX   XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. ( All requests ignored ) E. I have perfect credit ( FICO score XXXX XXXX, pay all of bills timely, and do not have any bankruptcies or evictions on my credit report. I am upset that U.S. Bank has implemented a chain of events that have harmed my credit score ( cancelling a long standing credit card account in good standing ) and have removed the fee waiver on my checking account as a result of cancelling my credit card account. I would understand U.S. Banks decision if my credit or earnings capacity was such that it put them at risk during the current coronavirus. In this case however, it is exactly the opposite. I paid the card in full, and want the account closed immediately.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received credits in excess of {$70000.00} from cancelled vacations to my XXXX  credit card account. 
On XX/XX/20 using online chat I requested that I be refunded the credit balance by way of a check. I was told to expect the check in 7-10 business days. 
On XX/XX/20, using online chat, I requested the status. I was told it was being reviewed. 
On XX/XX/20, using online chat, I requested the status. I was told that the refund had been approved on XX/XX/20 and to allow 7-10 business days to receive the refund. 
I also called to speak to an account specialist who told me that a check was being processed. 
On XX/XX/20, using online chat, I was told that a check was sent on XX/XX/20. 
It is now XX/XX/20 and I have still not received the refund. I did receive a letter today, dated XX/XX/20, from Citi saying that a refund check has been sent and I should receive it in 10-14 business days. If the check had been sent by the time that this letter was written, why will it take 10-14 business days to arrive? 
This credit had been in my account for some days before I requested the refund. Therefore Citi had confirmed that this was my money, in my account, i.e. it was genuine. 
Why then do they have to review whether I am entitled to a refund of my money and drag out that process for two weeks. If indeed a check was raised and sent on XX/XX/XXXX, why have I not received it when I have already received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX? 
Clearly it appears to be Citi 's policy to hold on to monies as long as they can under the pretext of review, having to raise a check and the mailing process. 
It is totally unacceptable that Citi withholds a large sum of money belonging to me without cost or penalty. 
The interest rate on my account is 13.99 % APR. If I owe Citi any money, they will charge me interest. As they have withheld my money, they should therefore pay me interest at that same rate. To date, since the day I first requested the refund, interest amounts to {$700.00}, according to my calculation, and continuing to accrue.

Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative: I do not believe this will be resolved with the company and they are not taking actions against the employee. They have multiple complaints and lawsuits which looks like we will have to do as well. On XX/XX/28, I was called 4 times, the last 3 were from a number with my same area code from home where my family lives. I thought something had happened to them. I answered and a man who quickly ( before I could even hear him ) stated his name and that he worked for XXXX XXXX. I have never had a collections place call me and I pay everything on time so I thought it was a scam. I asked to provide more information and he would only say it was from an apartment complex I lived at 2 years ago. At this point I am thinking it is definitely a scam as he refused to answer any other questions and continued to threaten me, I tell him I am going to call the original debtor and he tells me to not do that and then rattles out my social security number, date of birth, and drivers license and asks me to confirm this info, I didnt know what to do. He then proceeded to tell me if he was a fraud, he would use my info and open up credit cards and just pay himself. The aggressiveness and the push to " give me your credit card info now '' led me to believe it was a scam especially since I knew I had no outstanding debt. I hung up on him and called the apartment complex who told me that they were getting calls all day long about this and there was an error. People that lived there in past years were sent incorrectly to this new collection agency. They reassured me they would fix it and sent me the attached ledger to let me know I owed nothing and I was ok to ignore the caller. Later that night XXXX XXXX calls again ( the same rep ) and he continued to harass me when I tried to explain what happened to him. He said that he was going to report it to the credit bureaus which would ruin my credit, He said they would take action against me. He then said I could mail the ledger to their PO box but that its better to just pay it because it would take a long time to resolve it and in that time it would go on my credit. My girlfriend picked up the phone and got aggressive back with him and he placed her on hold so she hung up on him. We called XXXX XXXX and I spoke to a manager named " XXXX XXXX '' who asked us to email him the ledger ( so apparently PO box isnt necessary ). But in my opinion the burden of proof is on them not me to prove to a company I never heard of that I dont owe anything to an apartment complex I moved out of 2 years ago. I got harassed for no reason and nothing is being done to the employee or the company for what I had to go through. My next step is legal action.
Company public response: Company believes complaint caused principally by actions of third party outside the control or direction of the company

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem with paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had a vehicle loan with HMF that I was paying off at an accelerated rate by making extra payments. I decided I wanted to pay off my entire loan in one lump sum. When I contacted HMF to receive a payoff quote, I was told that some of my previous payments were being held " in suspense '' because of how far ahead I was on my payments ( roughly 22 months. ) I was unable to get an accurate payoff quote because of this. I was told to generate the payoff quote online, payoff the amount that was shown, and that any overage would be sent back to me as a refund once the loan was paid off. 

I generated a payoff quote on HMF 's website on XX/XX/2020. The payoff quote was {>= $1,000,000}. I knew this amount to be higher than what I owed but again was assured it would be handled by the payment processing department. I wrote the check, sent it in the mail to HMF. 

I received correspondence from HMF on XXXX XXXX from a gentleman that was assisting me in getting the payments that were being held in suspense cleared. He informed me via email that he was able to do so and that my payoff quote should now be correct. I had already sent the check in the mail by that point but generated another payoff quote online just to confirm. The payoff quote generated on XX/XX/XXXX after payments were applied properly was {$9000.00}. This is about what I expected the payoff quote to be so I felt confident that all issues had been resolved and that the difference would be handled when the loan was finalized. 

I received a letter in the mail from HMF that my loan was now paid off and I was able to receive my title from the DMV. I have contacted HMF numerous times over the last few weeks to get an update on my refund. Each time I am told that there has been no update from payment processing and there is nothing further they can do. 

The difference between what I sent to HMF ( {$10000.00} ) and what my corrected payoff quote amount was ( {$9000.00} ) is {$1000.00}. That is the amount I am owed from HMF. 

The last correspondence I have from HMF was on XX/XX/2020 from the same gentleman that was helping clear my payments via email. He confirmed that I would be receiving a refund and that he was " working on the refund now '' but explained that due to COVID19 accounts payable is working from home and processes are behind. I feel that I have been more than patient during this time and would simply appreciate an update on this situation and would like to receive the money I am due. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a XXXX ( XXXX ) AT & T Universal Card Mastercard that closes each month on the XXXX. Minimum payment is due by the XXXX of the month. I have an auto-payment agreement for them to take funds from my checking account for the minimum balance if it is still due by the end of the month. 

On my statement closing XXXX, there was a minimum payment due of {$130.00} by XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I logged into my account and successfully made the minimum payment of {$130.00}. 

And on XX/XX/XXXX, I logged into my account and successfully made an additional payment of {$160.00} to bring down my balance further. 

However, on XX/XX/XXXX, Citi drew the {$130.00} minimum balance from my checking account although I had more than paid what was due for the month. 

I was able to call them today XXXX and speak with employee XXXX, who politely looked into the matter and let me know I would be refunded the XX/XX/XXXX payment they took from my checking account. 

( I have had this happen once before with another card, XXXX VISA, about a year ago. For XXXX, this seemed to be a timing issue, but it should be completely avoidable with proper policy and systems changes. ) Most importantly, when I pay the minimum payment TWO WEEKS before it is due, I should not have the card company pulling funds from checking account. 

Needless to say, it makes it hard to plan for paying things like rent and utilities when a creditor violates an agreement and takes more money than is required. 

While I will get my refund, I do not want this to happen again EVER to me or any other card holder for any company. When minimum payment is made OR any payment is made that exceeds the minimum payment, then the creditor has NO RIGHT to take another payment. 

I would appreciate your looking into the matter. This is an especially difficult time for people who can't make two minimum payments for the same card for the same month if they have another card or other responsibilities due that month, too. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Kind regards, XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
A company called " Capital Link Management '' began texting me on XX/XX/XXXX from the number ( XXXX ) XXXX. The message reads : " [ NICKNAME & MAIDEN NAME ] your account has recently been sent to collections. Due to Covid-19, we understand that this is a difficult time and we are here to help. We have new options and programs to assist you in resolving this matter. Please call to take advantage of this offer XXXX. '' This sounded like scam. Since they were using a nickname and my maiden name that I do not use when doing any business and knowing that I always pay my bills on time, I thought nothing of it. 

I then received a similar text on XX/XX/XXXX. It read " [ NICKNAME & MAIDEN NAME ] This is a message in regards to a settlement offer on your account. We have some Options to help during these tough times. Please call us at XXXX. '' I then started received more texts referencing offers to settle debts with " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. '' Sometimes two copies of the same message were sent on the same day. Since I hadn't done business with this company, I still ignored the messages as they seemed like a phishing scam. On XX/XX/XXXX I responded " Please stop texting me. STOP '' and then received an automatic reply from Capital Link Management that I had opted out of their texting service and will no longer receive messages. This was the first time their company name was mentioned. 
I started receiving daily calls from Capital Link Management at the beginning of XXXX from XXXX. They would leave messages saying various things like " We are trying to find the location of [ NICKNAME MAIDEN NAME ]. '' and " We are debt collector trying to collect a debt from you. '' I also received a strange voicemail from Capital Link Management saying my bank rejected a payment that I had scheduled with them ... which of course, I never did as I have been ignoring the calls. They also referenced the " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX '' company was negatively reporting on my credit report, which isn't true either. 

I blocked the number and are still receiving daily voicemails from this company. So in additional to harassment, I am being called about a debt that I do not owe.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to complain about the extremely inconvenient and possibly willfully deceptive nature of deferred interest promotional balance repayments on the Lowes/Synchrony Bank credit card. 

I made a 12-month deferred interest promotional purchase on XX/XX/XXXX and expected, like with other payment systems, that my monthly statement would reflect my regular purchases plus the minimum monthly repayment amount on the promotional balance. This is not the case. My XXXX statement balance includes regular purchases plus the entire promotional balance, and Im left to manually calculate, each month, for twelve months, my actual statement balance less the promotional balance, plus the promotional balance divided by the promotional period. 

This is absurdly inconvenient and Im adamant that tens of thousands of Lowes customers with deferred interest promotional balances are not taking the time to do this, and are thereby either unnecessarily repaying deferred interest promotional balances early, or incurring fines for errors in their monthly manual repayment calculations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XX/XX/XXXX Time : XXXX MT Company : Wells Fargo Bank Amount disputed : {$350.00} Issue : I was making a cash deposit in a local ATM, when in the middle of making the transaction of depositing eight bills of {$50.00}, the ATM machine got stuck and it started beeping, displaying an " error message. '' I waited for about 5 minutes and I finally got a receipt from the ATM proving my deposited amount of {$400.00}. I immediately called the help phone line posted on the ATM to verify this and a Wells Fargo representative got on the line with me. He reviewed my account and I logged in to my online banking app in my phone, and the recent transactions of {$400.00} shown as " check deposit '' plus another {$50.00} amount as " cash deposit '' were shown. The Wells Fargo agent verified this and promised that this cash deposit will be available within the next business day. Not until Sunday, I checked my online bank account and {$400.00} were deducted as a " cash adjustment. '' I called Wells Fargo again on XX/XX/XXXX and the Wells Fargo Claims Office wasn't open so I had to call again on Monday ( XX/XX/XXXX ). Due to very long waiting times and inefficiencies to transfer me, I had to call Wells Fargo a total of 5 times regarding this issue and spent over 3 hours on the phone with agents that were not helpful in resolving this matter. The last agent claimed to have created a claim case for me but they never deposited the disputed amount, claiming that the ATM couldn't find my cash deposit of {$400.00}. She also said that the bank will not use video footage for their claim investigation. I emailed Wells Fargo via the secured message center in my online banking application once on XX/XX/XXXX and three times on XX/XX/XXXX. Finally a manager of the claims department said that she couldn't provide much information over email and that she didn't find a claim on my file. After I requested to have a direct phone line for a manager so I can speak with management regarding this issue, I was given the wrong extension line, and as of today ( XX/XX/XXXX ), I called 3 times to a dead phone line. As of tonight ( XXXX ) at XXXX MT, Wells Fargo has deleted all records of my email exchanges with them ( which were available earlier today ), leaving me only with email notifications sent to me stating that they have received my previous online messages. 

I'm frustrated and disappointed at how Wells Fargo has handled my claim case. We are experiencing a recession and this bank is fraudulently withholding money from my account when I made a cash deposit to an ATM. If this happened to me, I can't imagine this happening to other people that might difficulties understating the bank system, are economically disadvantaged, have no English, or are not aware of their consumer rights. I have been a costumer for Wells Fargo since I was XXXX  years old, have a excellent credit score, and this issue has never happened to me. 

This situation has left me with a very bad Wells Fargo experience and has wasted many hours of my time. I plead the CFPB to investigate this claim so this doesn't happen to me or any other consumer. I can provide you with records of the receipt given by the ATM, the location of the ATM that had a security camera, record of my calls with Wells Fargo, and email notifications. Thank you.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX : A brief history I was born and raised in Colorado. After a few tries at college I decided to try a career as an XXXX XXXX. Growing up I had a flair for decorating. I had some initial success working for an XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX and before the age of 21, 2 of my projects were published in the Sunday home section of my local newspaper. 
I decided to attend a 2-year program to become a XXXX XXXX XXXX. To pay for my schooling I went to work for a XXXX in XXXX XXXX. I feel in love with the profession. I worked for several florists in XXXX XXXX before moving to XXXX, Colorado. I was fortunate to work for Special event florists that recognized my talents and I began refining my personal style. In XXXX I won the XXXX XXXX of the XXXX XXXX  at the State florists convention. 
I met my partner XXXX after moving to XXXX Colorado in XXXX. He worked for XXXX XXXX, a grocery wholesaler. He was on the fast track to move to home office which meant we would be moving for several years. We moved to XXXX, New Mexico in XXXX, then back to XXXX for a few months then we moved again to XXXX, Alabama in XXXX. 
For a few years I worked at a flower shop in XXXX, but I yearned to be part of the XXXX flower scene. XXXX has a storied flower culture. The wealthy ladies of XXXX went to XXXX to learn flower design and brought back the techniques that when coupled with the local greenery created an extraordinary culture of flowers and an iconic look called the XXXX XXXX. A handful of the original ladies who learned from their English teachers were even featured in a book entitled XXXX XXXX XXXX  published by the XXXX XXXX XXXX. It would be XXXX in XXXX where I would I opened a tiny 400 sq. ft shop in XXXX XXXX. I drove an hour each way from XXXX to be part of that scene. 
The shop in XXXX was only meant to be a way to express myself and keep myself busy as XXXX and I would be moving again. In XXXX XXXX found out he was XXXX positive. After an agonizing year of treatment that left him severely debilitated, he passed away in XXXX. At 30 years I lost the person who believed in me and my talent. Before he died, he borrowed money from his mother against what would have been his inheritance, together with savings and credit cards I was able to open my XXXX XXXX. He also knew the darker side of my personality. Back then I had what some might call a short fuse. I often quit many of the florists I worked for out of frustration and anger. There was something at work inside of my brain that I couldnt control or comprehend. When I went to work for myself everything suddenly changed. I had a handle on my mental health for the first time in many years. 
The owner of the 400 sq. ft building I rented added on an additional 300  sq. Ft to accommodate my growing business. By XXXX I had moved from the 700 sq. ft location to a 1500 sq. ft storefront in XXXX XXXX on XXXX XXXX, eventually moving to a 3000 sq. ft space. Again in XXXX XXXX. By this time, I was an in-demand XXXX providing flowers for social events. 
I had many firsts for a XXXX XXXX man in XXXX, providing the dcor/designs for : XXXX XXXX, providing floral content for XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX   magazine and others. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, traveling with them to their yearly conventions throughout the United States XXXX XXXX, publisher of XXXX XXXX among other magazines. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX most prestigious fundraiser in XXXX. 
The XXXX XXXX XXXX An Alabama XXXX inauguration Alabama XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX And many weddings and social events. The people and many corporations in XXXX had embraced me and my work. 
When I told my parents, I was moving to XXXX they were very concerned. They had a secret they never told me. I was not XXXX at all. I was half XXXX XXXX XXXX. My parents had adopted me after I was placed in their foster home. My birth mother, XXXX was born to a family in XXXX, Utah. When she was XXXX years old her mother passed away. Her father was overwhelmed with his 7 children and the decision was made to put the children up for adoption. She and her brothers and sisters were sent to live with various families. My mother and her sister XXXX were sent to XXXX and XXXX XXXX. They did not want/like my mother. In fact, she was sent back to her father 2 times. At XXXX years old my mother gave birth to a still-born baby girl. The father was XXXX XXXX, her adoptive father. He had been XXXX XXXX her for years. When she was XXXX years old, they decided to get rid of her and she was sent to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. There was nothing wrong with her but during that period in Colorado there were no social services for children. People would simply leave unwanted children with them. When she was XXXX, she was XXXX by an XXXX American orderly, my father. I was taken from her at birth and placed in a foster home run by XXXX and XXXX XXXX. I was later adopted by XXXX and XXXX. At XXXX years old I found out I was adopted. The origin of my beginnings gave me great anxiety. I wondered why my mother did not want me. Why did she give me up? At the age of XXXX I finally understand my emotions and anxiety all those years. I was always looking for love and acceptance. 
When I opened my shop and through the subsequent years, I found the love and acceptance I had always been searching for. The everyday operations kept my mind busy and alert and the planning and execution of large events gave me a sense of accomplishment. I have a box that I have keep with me with notes from my clients. The overall theme of each note focuss not only on the professional work I performed but also the pleasure of getting to know me, with many expressing what a kind man I was. I felt blessed to be recognized as a good steward of the resources entrusted to me. 

My Dream In XXXX I had saved enough money to buy a piece of property in XXXX, Alabama. The property was offered by XXXX and XXXX XXXX, a local couple who owned XXXX, a small eatery in XXXX. 
The property was a perfect fit for me. I could run the business in the back and have a showroom for my event decor. Eventually when I retired, I planned to rent the property so that I could retire and be able to travel and pass the property to my family. This was my American Dream. I understood that financial freedom would allow me to pursue many opportunities that had alluded my own parents like traveling. 
In XXXX I signed the mortgage for the project with a construction budget of XXXX from XXXX bank with an interest rate of 6.5 %. At the time I owned a home in XXXX that I purchased in XXXX for XXXX. I improved the property adding a new kitchen and an extensive garden that included a koi pond. The Garden was chosen as a stop on the exclusive XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and was also featured on the cover of XXXX XXXX. I sold the property for XXXX and realized a profit of XXXX. Selling my home was a requirement of the loan. XXXX XXXX, my loan consultant was adamant I use that money to purchase merchandise to sell in my new store. 
When the building was finished in XXXX the builder, XXXX builders revealed they went over the construction budget by XXXX. I had been required by XXXX to hire a construction supervisor and was also required to give them a XXXX contingency fee should the builder go over budget. I thought I done everything right. By this time XXXX had merged with Regions. XXXX, my contact at XXXX XXXX left before the merger and I was given a new contact at Regions, XXXX. It was shortly after that when I heard from XXXX. She advised me that Regions would fund the extra XXXX, but my interest rate would change from 6.5 % to 8.5 %. My mortgage payment would go from XXXX a month to over XXXX a month. A difference of XXXX! WOW! I had proven I could afford the XXXX a month but XXXX for 20 years would be a real stretch. I tried reasoning with XXXX. I proposed adding the XXXX to the mortgage, adding the XXXX to the back of the loan, anything but changing the interest. She wouldnt budge. I tried obtaining a new loan from other sources but with no luck. Even though I did everything right I was punished because the builder went over budget. For so many years I had given XXXX everything I had. Whenever I was asked to donate, I donated. Whenever anyone needed help, I helped. I thought all the good will I had shown my customers and XXXX at-large would come back to me. I took this action personally. This did not seem like the XXXX I knew. A place where despite the history of oppression, those who valued my work opened their arms to me. 
The anxiety that I had been able to keep in check for years became unbearable. I remember the day shortly after I had moved into the new building when XXXX showed up unannounced. She told me that unless I signed the new mortgage, I would lose my building. Backed into a corner I unwittingly signed the mortgage. I always understood that when one is in business everything is at-risk. Anything can happen, but I never dreamed that an institution whose very business is to aid borrowers would treat me with such ill regard. 
One problem after another came my way. That same year XXXX XXXX XXXX forgot to put my listing in the phone book. People still used the phonebook in XXXX. No new customers for a year. Many of my customers thought I went out of business. Little annoyances became big issues. I had to cut the hours of my assistant XXXX who took orders and did some of the book work. She got upset and went to work for XXXX. She called my customers and told them I fired her. More than 50 % of my customers left. Then the XXXX recession hit. Barring what happened with XXXX which was a result of this issue highlights what can happen in business, why everything is always at risk. I had weathered many storms over the years but coupled with my crippling mortgage these problems created a nightmare situation. 
Up until this nightmare I felt so blessed and thankful. This black-brown kid from a poor family with a humble beginning raised by parents with a XXXX grade education had finally made it. The sense of satisfaction I had from owning my own business was such a grounding force for me. But before I knew it, I was clinically depressed. I started using anti-depressants and stimulants to keep me going. By XXXX my whole demeanor had changed. I was angry, battling side effects from the prescribed drugs and constantly contemplating suicide. I had always been a social drinker, but I even tried drinking during the day. I tried anything to escape. I knew that drugs and alcohol were the refuge of the disaffected, but I was powerless. My partner XXXX was a recovered alcoholic. He had been sober for 10 years when we met. The reason he had become an alcoholic was from an early business failure he went through. We had talked about the conditions that had contributed to the demise of his business. We had discussed at length the issues I might encounter when I opened the business. I thought I had covered all my bases, but like many minority businesss I had always been underfunded. I didnt have multiple streams of income ; I did not have family to borrow from like XXXX had been able to do. Through the lens of time I can see things differently. 
By XXXX I was so angry I went to the Regions corporate building in downtown XXXX a few days before XXXX and demanded to talk to the president of the bank. I was eventually escorted upstairs and talked with several people from Regions. I was reassured I would receive help after the first of the year. I did but it was too little, too late. The bank would eventually sell the loan to a debt collector who would call me and say things to put me on the defensive. Telling me what a shame it would be to lose such a nice building. I listed the building in XXXX and it eventually sold in XXXX. I remember the scene at the lawyers office so clearly. The lawyer handling the closing made a point of sharing that the owner would be receiving a special interest rate thanks to a special program. My heart was so heavy. I had been begging for years for help and it seemed like the only people who received help where the ones who didnt need it. 
We can look back at the interest rates being charged in XXXX and see that they were in the 6 % range. If you are white and well connected or rich maybe they were even lower. What I do know is that 8.5 % was too high. It was punitive. 
The events leading up to this time in history helped me to find my voice. One of the worst things that happen to people who are marginalized is that they lose their voice. 

The cries of XXXX XXXX that he could not breath went unheeded by those in charge. 
XXXX XXXX killed XXXX XXXX by putting his knee on XXXX XXXX neck for XXXX minutes and Regions had their Knee on mine for 6 years. Its difficult to put into words the despair brought on by the wounds of unfairness. Whats worse than losing your life? I would argue losing your dream! Death is difficult for those who are left behind. But once you are dead you feel no pain. I had to relive my pain every day. 
XXXX XXXX from XXXX, Our struggle is not the struggle of a day, a week, a month or a year, it is the struggle of a lifetime. 
Dreams sometimes take a lifetime to achieve. Mine took 40 years. And yet almost overnight it was destroyed. To have ones life work dematerialize before your very eyes is demoralizing in every sense of the word. 
Regions and XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX I challenge you to listen and take up my cause. Your bank has announced that it wants to use its resources to address XXXX XXXX, inclusivity and advancement. 
From an XXXX article. Regions XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX said it is the companys responsibility to use our resources and expertise in ways that address disparities and create positive change. 
I submit to you that the actions your bank took by raising my interest rate was neither fair nor reasonable. Raising the interest rate on my loan put an undue burden on my business that in turn put an undue stress on both my physical and mental health. Borrowers like me have systematically been forced to accept unfair treatment by financial institutions who back their customers into a corner. Neither public interest nor the interest of the borrower is served by such treatment. The people you serve both black/brown or white deserve better. Their dreams matter as should the dreams of all who live and strive to provide a build a better XXXX and a better world for themselves.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The issue at hand is the re-evaluation process for credit limits with Citi Bank Credit cards. 

in general this complaint is to address the unfair practice of report pulling to reduce credit limits.

This practice creates a cyclic problem for consumers due to the following : Card 1 : had a XXXX limit in XXXX of XXXX Card 1 : was reduced to XXXX in XXXX of XXXX, just XXXX dollars over balance. 

this drastic reduction significantly raised utilization and inversely decreased credit score for having over 95 % utilization, thus raising risk factorization. 

Card 2 : had a XXXX limit in XXXX of XXXX Card 2 : had a XXXX limit in XXXX of XXXX,, about XXXX dollars above balance. 
Card 2 : had a XXXX limit in XXXX of XXXX, about 200 dollars above balance. 

Requested the balances be reinstated by citi bank, citi bank responded with calling XXXX  credit reporting. 
Also, using the automated " increase request '' was denied, system stated balances can only be increased every 6 months. 

This predatory practice of lowers limits just above balances is damaging to consumers because there is no control metrics to in place that protect the consumer. Credit score Hemorrhaging affects not just credit cards, but housing and employment opportunities as well. 

example of existing issue : Citi see a score change, Citi reduce limits Citi increase utilization to almost maxed out, score decrease significantly Citi see dramatic score change, Citi reduce limit threshold just above balance again. 
again, score lowers, and the cycle continues.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Regarding : Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing ; XXXX, SC On XX/XX/2020 I made a partial payment online towards our XXXX mortgage in the amount of {$410.00}. I have a confirmation number for that amount and a receipt for it. On XX/XX/2020 Shellpoint Mortgage withdrew and UNAUTORIZED AMOUNT of {$1300.00} from my checking account which caused overdrafts of NINE transactions resulting in overdraft fees totaling {$250.00}.

I immediatley contacted the bank to which I was told to contact the mortgage company directly, which I did. The customer service agent seemed concerned and remorseful and told me that she was putting in a request for the return of the {$1300.00} and would take 3-5 business days, a request for the overdraft fees to be paid to us for {$250.00}, and investigation as to why this happened when it clearly said {$410.00}, and a request for a supervisor to contact me within 48hours.

Well the only thing that did happen was I received the refund of the {$1300.00} 3 weeks later. I have been fighting every week to have the overdraft fees they caused to refunded to us to no avail. There have been over 9 phone calls and 6 emails and I have only received ONE return call from someone self proclaiming to be our assigned Point of Contact 's supervisor and 2 emails back from I don't really know who -- I emailed our POC XXXX XXXX, who doesn't bother to reply or answer his phone, or return voicemails. Mr. XXXX XXXX claimed to be XXXX XXXX 's supervisor -- I spoke with him on Thursday XX/XX/XXXX ( 21 days I've waited for someone to contact me about this nightmare ... .21 days ). His words to me were " let me work on getting you your money back '' and he REFUSED to give me his direct number, email or any other contact information. 

The initial call I was told the overdraft fees would be returned to me. 
2nd call I had to make on XX/XX/XXXX I was told I had to provide proof the overdraft happened and that fee 's were incurred. I sent over the bank statement showing Shellpoint ILLEGALLY withdrew {$1300.00} and the ledger balance being negative {$110.00}, followed by all of the negative transactions in the ledger balance column and the banks overdraft fees on XX/XX/XXXX {$36.00} and XX/XX/XXXX {$210.00}. ( for security XXXX redacted names and amounts of the vendors that were paid, but left unaltered the ledger balance column 3rd call XX/XX/XXXX I call again and am told that they wanted " proof that my account was not negative to begin with ''. 
( well if the withdrawal of {$1300.00} only resulted in a negative balance of {$110.00} then that means my beginning balance was {$1100.00} but for some reason they wanted more. So I sent the balance before their ILLEGAL withdrawal of {$1300.00}, showing it was a positive balance of {$1100.00} unredacted, along with the unauthorized withdrawal and bank NSF fees. 

I receive an email telling me that they wanted proof of " both withdrawals '' being taken out -- I have NO idea what they are saying so I call again. I can't speak with a supervisor, our Assigned Point of Contact, the self proclaimed supervisor of our Assigned Point of Contact, the payments department that handles this refund or anyone else except the customer service representative that I was speaking with that was only reading notes. So, I emailed our Assigned Point of Contact, XXXX XXXX. I received an email response from XXXX XXXX saying, " as we discussed give my department time to work on this '' -- which did NOT address the issue I emailed about this new email that very day. I call again and request a return call from a supervisor, which is supposed to be done within 24 hours, or so I was told. 

Today, XX/XX/XXXX, I receive an email from someone, I have no idea who, the return email address is from XXXX XXXX, but as I said, I've emailed him at that address and have had XXXX XXXX reply instead, so really it seems like an open email to whoever. 

The email is now telling me yet again, to send the bank statement " completely unaltered ''. It's just been one thing after another after another with them. They are coming up with excuses to not do what they are supposed to do, as promised, for whatever reason. Maybe they think I will give up and they won't have to pay, I have no idea. 

I questioned XXXX XXXX about what his investigation department found was the reason for such an error, and I was brushed off completely. Every time I call I ask why this happened and NO ONE answers To date : I have called on XX/XX/XXXX with XXXX XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX To date : NO Refund of our overdraft fee 's. We have since closed that account that they have tampered with and STOLE that money from. But we have yet to have any refund of the overdraft fee 's. 

Where is the accountability?? WHY and HOW is a mortgage company ALLOWED to STEAL an amount from our account that is greater than authorized?? HOW and WHY are they allowed to cause such financial hardship and they play these ridiciulous and unnecessary GAMES instead of just refunding the overdraft fee 's they caused??? Why aren't they accountable??? IF I stole that money from anyone 's account I would surely be arrested and put in jail, but a big mortgage company get 's a way with it??? During the worst financial and health crisis our country has ever seen, while we are already struggling to keep a roof over our heads, our electricity on and food on our table, we are further victimized by our very own mortgage company causing us further undo financial duress. WHO PROTECTS US???? We just want our fee 's returned. That's is all. Nothing more and nothing less. It's the least they can do after what they've done. Lesson learned. We will NEVER pay a single entity online, or in the mail, with our private banking accounts. Not ever.
Company public response: Company believes complaint is the result of an isolated error

XXXX XXXX from N.A.R. Inc. has in fact called me a couple of times today, within a 4 minute timeframe, I got a call from my mother stating that I needed to call her back because she received a call from XXXX directly after her attempt to call me.

I do not answer unidentified number calls, unless they leave a message, I dont call them back. To top that off ... I called her back twice, and she didnt answer. This is harassment ... plain and simple.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XX/XX/XXXX I reached out to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX via XXXX requesting pricing to install pavers in my back yard. 

We agreed to the terms, see attached As shown on the invoice they asked for a deposit to cover the materials I paid {$1100.00} to the company for the materials On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX   XXXX showed up at my house and proceeded to prepare the yard for the pavers. Soon after their arrival it appeared XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX was not planning to level or prep the ground as they had told me they would. When I questioned their plans one of the crew said that was not what they planned to do and said if that what you want we quit and walked off the job. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX walked off the job leaving their trash but did not deliver the materials as per the invoice. 

I filed a dispute with Citibank on XX/XX/XXXX provide them complete details. 

On or about XX/XX/XXXX I receive a letter from Citibank denying my claim stating the dispute was about the quality of service. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I call and waited on hold for ~one hour. I spoke with XXXX who informed me that once a decision was made they would not revisit the matter even if they made a mistake. After multiple request to escalate XXXX said someone from their investigations department would be in touch within two days. I have not heard back from Citibank. 

I do not know how Citibank could come to a conclusion that this was a quality of service issue given I did not receive any services. 

As with most construction jobs the up front money is for materials and the person receiving the service holds money until the job is complete and satisfied. 

My dispute was that I did not receive the materials that I was charged for and that were spelled out on the invoice. The invoice is clear the deposit is for materials. 

Citibank has made a mistake in their decision, this is clearly not a quality of service issue and is providing no recourse to resolve this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I refinanced my existing mortgage with a separate bank. Upon closing with my new bank, I paid my loan in full at US Bank and Mortgage. Nearly four weeks later, they sent me an escrow check with my remaining escrow balance. However, on the balance I noticed they retained approximately {$240.00} to pay mortgage insurance! Why would they keep {$240.00} to pay mortgage insurance on a mortgage that I have just paid off. More troubling, is that this was done with no explanation whatsoever. I had to comb oover my statement to uncover the discrepancy. 

Upon calling US Bank, they informed me that I am paying for previous months and because I paid closed on XX/XX/XXXX, I am required to pay for the entire month of XXXX. This makes no sense, particularly where my mortgage insurance was not paid from my Escrow account on the first or 2nd of the month. This might seem like a small amount of money but {$240.00} goes a long way in my house and for my family. 

At a time where money is tight during the pandemic, I find this conduct egregious and I can't even imagine how many other consumers are subject to this type of predatory behavior. If my mortgage is discharged, I should be getting my ENTIRE ESCROW BALANCE returned. US BANK should not be allowed to retain money to make future mortgage insurance payments on a discharged mortgage.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am currently under a modification with Allied Servicing Co. I have attached a copy of the modification agreement, which I clearly signed under desperation in order to avoid being homeless. It is important to note that this agreement was only reach through forced foreclosure court proceedings as Allied Servicing refused to work with me initially.

Part of the agreement was for me to be able to refinance my 1st and 2nd mortgage prior to XX/XX/2020, which I was unable to do within the year due to my credit score. Then, Covid happened. The agreement states that unless I refinance before XX/XX/2020, I will have to pay the full amount owed ( approximately $ XXXXXXXX  ). I obviously do not have $ XXXX to pay out in a lump sum. 

I did not have any issues with my first mortgage company ( XXXX XXXX ) granting me a deferment for my mortgage payments nor with any of my other creditor. Once again, Allied Servicing is refusing to work with me and are demanding that I show proof of denial for refinance from three different lenders. As we all know, not all applications with mortgage lenders are subject to soft inquires, so I have had hits on my credit as a result of applying. 

This is not the first time Allied Servicing Co. has refused to work with me without forcing me into legal proceedings. Such legal proceedings have clearly added to my debt as they have unreasonably tagged on legal fees as well as other fees. I don't understand how forcing anyone into additional legal proceedings which lead to unreasonable fees is helpful to someone struggling with finances. 

I clearly do not have $ XXXX to pay off this second mortgage with Allied Servicing Co. by next month. I do not have any other means of income other than my employment. I am not asking for a deferment. I am simply asking for an extension of my modification for at least 6 more months so that I can refinance accordingly. My payments have been on time as per the agreement. 

I find the request of Allied Servicing Co. to be unreasonable and discriminatory, especially during this difficult time. Looking at my history with Allied Servicing Co., I believe their actions are due to the fact that I am am a woman of XX/XX/XXXX. 

I have attached relevant documentation for your review. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company disputes the facts presented in the complaint

Consumer complaint narrative:
USAA took all of my money in my accounts and took all the money comming into my account, social security : XXXX retirement : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, for a couple months until I opened a new account. Even after I opened a new account the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX continued for a few months wile I figured out I wasn't getting it. 

The problem was identity theft on my mother-in-laws account. She was having trouble a was calling on a regular basis, she even asked for a new card and was told no by USAA employee, this happened for months. USAA then came after my account. After the neglect handling of her account examples : not giving her a new card ; declining to give a new card ; not doing anything about a recurring charge from the same place for the same amount over and over ; not escalating accounts ; saying they are putting notes in the file and nobody can find. 

For what ever reason they closed her account but still continued to take this charge over and over after being told it wasn't legitimate charges. USAA then started to take everything from my account plus anything comming in, all of my direct deposits,. 

USAA has done nothing to fix this. I have called numerous times and have talked to the executive resolution team just told me they will escalate my account after months of waiting why wasn't that done already. The response was the other account was escalated. In other words I'm getting the run around.

Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I opened a new checking account with Suntrust for the specific purpose of transferring funds from XXXX, the selling app, where I sell face masks that I sew myself. Since the pandemic I have donated over XXXX masks to Nurses and first responders, I sell masks to cover my expenses. 

On XX/XX/XXXX my first deposit was made, and between XXXX XXXX deposits were made into the suntrust account. 1 deposit of {$50.00} was from my checking account with another bank, which I used to open the account. The other 13 deposits were from XXXX. When my funds cleared from a sale on the app, I immediately transferred the funds. 

In total, I have {$500.00} in the Suntrust checking account. 

For 10 days I was unable to access the account online, it prompted me to reset my password multiple times. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a welcome letter from Suntrust with checks for my account. I have not received any other communication from Suntrust. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I called Suntrust for help with accessing my online account. They told me my account was being closed for suspected fraud due to an investigation and report from another past banking institution that I used years prior. They told me my funds were being held for a minimum of 30 days. 

I told them this was unacceptable. I am very upset. I need this money to recover my expenses from sewing face masks and pay my daycare provider on Monday for the upcoming month. They allowed me to open an account and had no communication in the 9 days my account was open regarding this issue or investigation. All I have done is deposit money from the Selling app from the sale of face masks. 

After escalating to a supervisor he gave me an address in TN where I could mail a complaint. They were no help. 

My issue is that they could have easily seen an issue in my past banking history ( 2+ years prior ) when approving me for an account. There is no money owed to any banking institution. Instead, they allowed me to open an account and make $ XXXX deposits in a 9 day period with no communication on a potential issue. I had to seek them out to get an answer on how to access my funds and am now am being told I have to wait at least 30 days to access my funds. 

I havent done anything wrong and will be unable to pay my daycare provider on Monday which means I will have no care for my child and will be unable to go to work. 

I want my money ASAP as I am being punished by a bank for their own oversight. 

See attachments for screen shots of my XXXX sellers account and the direct deposits sent to Suntrust from this account. Please remove my seller account photos from the report that you publish.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was charged multiple late fees and interest charges to my Citi Cards account during the time that COVID-19 caused disruptions to businesses and to lives around the world! 

This matter began in XX/XX/2020 when I received a call from a Citi Cards representative stating that I missed a payment. I informed the representative that I did not recall using the card referenced and requested additional information on the charges so I could validate they were legitimate charges. The representative informed me that he was unable to see details but would transfer me to customer service who could assist me, which he immediately transferred me but a representative NEVER answered and the call and then I was disconnected. I tried calling several times thereafter ( days and weeks later ) and collection representative called me but customer service was not available, not even through the online chat portal. 

I eventually spoke with a professional representative who was extremely helpful in providing details of the charges, which was all I needed to pay the bill. In addition, he offered to credit late charges due to credit/payment history and the inconvenience but all of his attempts to credit the charges failed. The representative explained that the system would not allow him to apply the credit because my account was closed. I placed many calls after that call to have the late fees removed and resolve the delinquency but continuously experienced the same outcome, even with a supervisor. 

I paid the bill minus late charges. I was, and continue to be, in utter disbelief that during the time of a world-wide pandemic ( COVID-19 ), a company could be so insensitive to close a consumers account and continue assessing late fees knowing that CITI offices were closed, or operating on limited scheduling, reduced staffing, or whatever the reason may have been for not servicing customers! 

I had great credit prior to this matter, but Citi Cards has tarnished my credit and continues to do so monthly.

I wrote a complaint to multiple executives of the Citi Cards team and was told that charges would not be reversed because the payment was late - without acknowledging their lack of service to customers in previous months.
